summary.long: Luke is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Seeing that many did take in hand to set in order a narration of the matters that have been fully assured among us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as they did deliver to us, who from the beginning became eye-witnesses, and officers of the Word, --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it seemed good also to me, having followed from the first after all things exactly, to write to thee in order, most noble Theophilus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that thou mayest know the certainty of the things wherein thou wast instructed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was in the days of Herod, the king of Judea, a certain priest, by name Zacharias, of the course of Abijah, and his wife of the daughters of Aaron, and her name Elisabeth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were both righteous before God, going on in all the commands and righteousnesses of the Lord blameless,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they had no child, because that Elisabeth was barren, and both were advanced in their days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, in his acting as priest, in the order of his course before God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: according to the custom of the priesthood, his lot was to make perfume, having gone into the sanctuary of the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the multitude of the people were praying without, at the hour of the perfume.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there appeared to him a messenger of the Lord standing on the right side of the altar of the perfume,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Zacharias, having seen, was troubled, and fear fell on him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the messenger said unto him, `Fear not, Zacharias, for thy supplication was heard, and thy wife Elisabeth shall bear a son to thee, and thou shalt call his name John,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there shall be joy to thee, and gladness, and many at his birth shall joy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he shall be great before the Lord, and wine and strong drink he may not drink, and of the Holy Spirit he shall be full, even from his mother's womb;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and many of the sons of Israel he shall turn to the Lord their God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he shall go before Him, in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn hearts of fathers unto children, and disobedient ones to the wisdom of righteous ones, to make ready for the Lord, a people prepared.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zacharias said unto the messenger, `Whereby shall I know this? for I am aged, and my wife is advanced in her days?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the messenger answering said to him, `I am Gabriel, who have been standing near before God, and I was sent to speak unto thee, and to proclaim these good news to thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and lo, thou shalt be silent, and not able to speak, till the day that these things shall come to pass, because thou didst not believe my words, that shall be fulfilled in their season.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people were waiting for Zacharias, and wondering at his tarrying in the sanctuary,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having come out, he was not able to speak to them, and they perceived that a vision he had seen in the sanctuary, and he was beckoning to them, and did remain dumb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when the days of his service were fulfilled, he went away to his house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and after those days, his wife Elisabeth conceived, and hid herself five months, saying --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thus hath the Lord done to me, in days in which He looked upon [me], to take away my reproach among men.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the sixth month was the messenger Gabriel sent by God, to a city of Galilee, the name of which [is] Nazareth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to a virgin, betrothed to a man, whose name [is] Joseph, of the house of David, and the name of the virgin [is] Mary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the messenger having come in unto her, said, `Hail, favoured one, the Lord [is] with thee; blessed [art] thou among women;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and she, having seen, was troubled at his word, and was reasoning of what kind this salutation may be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the messenger said to her, `Fear not, Mary, for thou hast found favour with God;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and lo, thou shalt conceive in the womb, and shalt bring forth a son, and call his name Jesus;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he shall be great, and Son of the Highest he shall be called, and the Lord God shall give him the throne of David his father,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and he shall reign over the house of Jacob to the ages; and of his reign there shall be no end.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Mary said unto the messenger, `How shall this be, seeing a husband I do not know?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the messenger answering said to her, `The Holy Spirit shall come upon thee, and the power of the Highest shall overshadow thee, therefore also the holy-begotten thing shall be called Son of God;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and lo, Elisabeth, thy kinswoman, she also hath conceived a son in her old age, and this is the sixth month to her who was called barren;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because nothing shall be impossible with God.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Mary said, `Lo, the maid-servant of the Lord; let it be to me according to thy saying,' and the messenger went away from her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Mary having arisen in those days, went to the hill-country, with haste, to a city of Judea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and entered into the house of Zacharias, and saluted Elisabeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when Elisabeth heard the salutation of Mary, the babe did leap in her womb; and Elisabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and spake out with a loud voice, and said, `Blessed [art] thou among women, and blessed [is] the fruit of thy womb;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and whence [is] this to me, that the mother of my Lord might come unto me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for, lo, when the voice of thy salutation came to my ears, leap in gladness did the babe in my womb;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and happy [is] she who did believe, for there shall be a completion to the things spoken to her from the Lord.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Mary said, `My soul doth magnify the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And my spirit was glad on God my Saviour,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because He looked on the lowliness of His maid-servant, For, lo, henceforth call me happy shall all the generations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He who is mighty did to me great things, And holy [is] His name,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And His kindness [is] to generations of generations, To those fearing Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did powerfully with His arm, He scattered abroad the proud in the thought of their heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought down the mighty from thrones, And He exalted the lowly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hungry He did fill with good, And the rich He sent away empty,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He received again Israel His servant, To remember kindness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As He spake unto our fathers, To Abraham and to his seed -- to the age.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Mary remained with her about three months, and turned back to her house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to Elisabeth was the time fulfilled for her bringing forth, and she bare a son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the neighbours and her kindred heard that the Lord was making His kindness great with her, and they were rejoicing with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, on the eighth day, they came to circumcise the child, and they were calling him by the name of his father, Zacharias,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his mother answering said, `No, but he shall be called John.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said unto her -- `There is none among thy kindred who is called by this name,'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were making signs to his father, what he would wish him to be called,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having asked for a tablet, he wrote, saying, `John is his name;' and they did all wonder;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his mouth was opened presently, and his tongue, and he was speaking, praising God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And fear came upon all those dwelling around them, and in all the hill-country of Judea were all these sayings spoken of,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all who heard did lay them up in their hearts, saying, `What then shall this child be?' and the hand of the Lord was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zacharias his father was filled with the Holy Spirit, and did prophesy, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Blessed [is] the Lord, the God of Israel, Because He did look upon, And wrought redemption for His people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And did raise an horn of salvation to us, In the house of David His servant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As He spake by the mouth of His holy prophets, Which have been from the age;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salvation from our enemies, And out of the hand of all hating us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To do kindness with our fathers, And to be mindful of His holy covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An oath that He sware to Abraham our father,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To give to us, without fear, Out of the hand of our enemies having been delivered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To serve Him, in holiness and righteousness Before Him, all the days of our life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou, child, Prophet of the Highest Shalt thou be called; For thou shalt go before the face of the Lord, To prepare His ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To give knowledge of salvation to His people In remission of their sins,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Through the tender mercies of our God, In which the rising from on high did look upon us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To give light to those sitting in darkness and death-shade, To guide our feet to a way of peace.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the child grew, and was strengthened in spirit, and he was in the deserts till the day of his shewing unto Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass in those days, there went forth a decree from Caesar Augustus, that all the world be enrolled --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this enrollment first came to pass when Cyrenius was governor of Syria --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all were going to be enrolled, each to his proper city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the city of Nazareth, to Judea, to the city of David, that is called Bethlehem, because of his being of the house and family of David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to enroll himself with Mary his betrothed wife, being with child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, in their being there, the days were fulfilled for her bringing forth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and she brought forth her son -- the first-born, and wrapped him up, and laid him down in the manger, because there was not for them a place in the guest-chamber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were shepherds in the same region, lodging in the field, and keeping the night-watches over their flock,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and lo, a messenger of the Lord stood over them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they feared a great fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the messenger said to them, `Fear not, for lo, I bring you good news of great joy, that shall be to all the people --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because there was born to you to-day a Saviour -- who is Christ the Lord -- in the city of David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and this [is] to you the sign: Ye shall find a babe wrapped up, lying in the manger.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And suddenly there came with the messenger a multitude of the heavenly host, praising God, and saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Glory in the highest to God, and upon earth peace, among men -- good will.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when the messengers were gone away from them to the heavens, that the men, the shepherds, said unto one another, `We may go over indeed unto Bethlehem, and see this thing that hath come to pass, that the Lord did make known to us.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came, having hasted, and found both Mary, and Joseph, and the babe lying in the manger,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having seen, they made known abroad concerning the saying spoken to them concerning the child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all who heard, did wonder concerning the things spoken by the shepherds unto them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Mary was preserving all these things, pondering in her heart;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the shepherds turned back, glorifying and praising God, for all those things they heard and saw, as it was spoken unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when eight days were fulfilled to circumcise the child, then was his name called Jesus, having been so called by the messenger before his being conceived in the womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the days of their purification were fulfilled, according to the law of Moses, they brought him up to Jerusalem, to present to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as it hath been written in the Law of the Lord, -- `Every male opening a womb shall be called holy to the Lord,'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to give a sacrifice, according to that said in the Law of the Lord, `A pair of turtle-doves, or two young pigeons.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And lo, there was a man in Jerusalem, whose name [is] Simeon, and this man is righteous and devout, looking for the comforting of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was upon him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath been divinely told him by the Holy Spirit -- not to see death before he may see the Christ of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came in the Spirit to the temple, and in the parents bringing in the child Jesus, for their doing according to the custom of the law regarding him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he took him in his arms, and blessed God, and he said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Now Thou dost send away Thy servant, Lord, according to Thy word, in peace,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because mine eyes did see Thy salvation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which Thou didst prepare before the face of all the peoples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a light to the uncovering of nations, and the glory of Thy people Israel.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph and his mother were wondering at the things spoken concerning him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Simeon blessed them, and said unto Mary his mother, `Lo, this [one] is set for the falling and rising again of many in Israel, and for a sign spoken against --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (and also thine own soul shall a sword pass through) -- that the reasonings of many hearts may be revealed.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was Anna, a prophetess, daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher, she was much advanced in days, having lived with an husband seven years from her virginity,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and she [is] a widow of about eighty-four years, who did depart not from the temple, with fasts and supplications serving, night and day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and she, at that hour, having come in, was confessing, likewise, to the Lord, and was speaking concerning him, to all those looking for redemption in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they finished all things, according to the Law of the Lord, they turned back to Galilee, to their city Nazareth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the child grew and was strengthened in spirit, being filled with wisdom, and the grace of God was upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his parents were going yearly to Jerusalem, at the feast of the passover,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when he became twelve years old, they having gone up to Jerusalem, according to the custom of the feast,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having finished the days, in their returning the child Jesus remained behind in Jerusalem, and Joseph and his mother did not know,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and, having supposed him to be in the company, they went a day's journey, and were seeking him among the kindred and among the acquaintances,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not having found him, they turned back to Jerusalem seeking him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, after three days, they found him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the teachers, both hearing them and questioning them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all those hearing him were astonished at his understanding and answers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, having seen him, they were amazed, and his mother said unto him, `Child, why didst thou thus to us? lo, thy father and I, sorrowing, were seeking thee.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, `Why [is it] that ye were seeking me? did ye not know that in the things of my Father it behoveth me to be?'
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and they did not understand the saying that he spake to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he went down with them, and came to Nazareth, and he was subject to them, and his mother was keeping all these sayings in her heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus was advancing in wisdom, and in stature, and in favour with God and men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the fifteenth year of the government of Tiberius Caesar -- Pontius Pilate being governor of Judea, and Herod tetrarch of Galilee, and Philip his brother, tetrarch of Ituraea and of the region of Trachonitis, and Lysanias tetrarch of Abilene --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Annas and Caiaphas being chief priests -- there came a word of God unto John the son of Zacharias, in the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he came to all the region round the Jordan, proclaiming a baptism of reformation -- to remission of sins,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as it hath been written in the scroll of the words of Isaiah the prophet, saying, `A voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, straight make ye His paths;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: every valley shall be filled, and every mountain and hill shall be made low, and the crooked shall become straightness, and the rough become smooth ways;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all flesh shall see the salvation of God.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said he to the multitudes coming forth to be baptised by him, `Brood of vipers! who did prompt you to flee from the coming wrath?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: make, therefore, fruits worthy of the reformation, and begin not to say within yourselves, We have a father -- Abraham; for I say to you, that God is able out of these stones to raise children to Abraham;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and already also the axe unto the root of the trees is laid, every tree, therefore, not making good fruit is cut down, and to fire it is cast.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the multitudes were questioning him, saying, `What, then, shall we do?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he answering saith to them, `He having two coats -- let him impart to him having none, and he having victuals -- in like manner let him do.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there came also tax-gatherers to be baptised, and they said unto him, `Teacher, what shall we do?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said unto them, `Exact no more than that directed you.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And questioning him also were those warring, saying, `And we, what shall we do?' and he said unto them, `Do violence to no one, nor accuse falsely, and be content with your wages.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people are looking forward, and all are reasoning in their hearts concerning John, whether or not he may be the Christ;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered, saying to all, `I indeed with water do baptise you, but he cometh who is mightier than I, of whom I am not worthy to loose the latchet of his sandals -- he shall baptise you with the Holy Spirit and with fire;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whose winnowing shovel [is] in his hand, and he will thoroughly cleanse his floor, and will gather the wheat to his storehouse, and the chaff he will burn with fire unquenchable.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, therefore, indeed with many other things, exhorting, he was proclaiming good news to the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Herod the tetrarch, being reproved by him concerning Herodias the wife of Philip his brother, and concerning all the evils that Herod did,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: added also this to all, that he shut up John in the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, in all the people being baptised, Jesus also being baptised, and praying, the heaven was opened,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Holy Spirit came down in a bodily appearance, as if a dove, upon him, and a voice came out of heaven, saying, `Thou art My Son -- the Beloved, in thee I did delight.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus himself was beginning to be about thirty years of age, being, as was supposed, son of Joseph,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the [son] of Eli, the [son] of Matthat, the [son] of Levi, the [son] of Melchi, the [son] of Janna, the [son] of Joseph,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the [son] of Mattathias, the [son] of Amos, the [son] of Naum, the [son] of Esli,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the [son] of Naggai, the [son] of Maath, the [son] of Mattathias, the [son] of Semei, the [son] of Joseph, the [son] of Juda,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the [son] of Joanna, the [son] of Rhesa, the [son] of Zerubbabel, the [son] of Shealtiel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the [son] of Neri, the [son] of Melchi, the [son] of Addi, the [son] of Cosam, the [son] of Elmodam, the [son] of Er,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the [son] of Jose, the [son] of Eliezer, the [son] of Jorim, the [son] of Matthat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the [son] of Levi, the [son] of Simeon, the [son] of Juda, the [son] of Joseph, the [son] of Jonan, the [son] of Eliakim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the [son] of Melea, the [son] of Mainan, the [son] of Mattatha, the [son] of Nathan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the [son] of David, the [son] of Jesse, the [son] of Obed, the [son] of Booz, the [son] of Salmon, the [son] of Nahshon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the [son] of Amminadab, the [son] of Aram, the [son] of Esrom, the [son] of Pharez,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the [son] of Judah, the [son] of Jacob, the [son] of Isaac, the [son] of Abraham, the [son] of Terah, the [son] of Nahor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the [son] of Serug, the [son] of Reu, the [son] of Peleg, the [son] of Eber,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the [son] of Salah, the [son] of Cainan, the [son] of Arphaxad, the [son] of Shem, the [son] of Noah, the [son] of Lamech,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the [son] of Methuselah, the [son] of Enoch, the [son] of Jared, the [son] of Mahalaleel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the [son] of Cainan, the [son] of Enos, the [son] of Seth, the [son] of Adam, the [son] of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, turned back from the Jordan, and was brought in the Spirit to the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: forty days being tempted by the Devil, and he did not eat anything in those days, and they having been ended, he afterward hungered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Devil said to him, `If Son thou art of God, speak to this stone that it may become bread.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered him, saying, `It hath been written, that, not on bread only shall man live, but on every saying of God.'
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And the Devil having brought him up to an high mountain, shewed to him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Devil said to him, `To thee I will give all this authority, and their glory, because to me it hath been delivered, and to whomsoever I will, I do give it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thou, then, if thou mayest bow before me -- all shall be thine.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answering him said, `Get thee behind me, Adversary, for it hath been written, Thou shalt bow before the Lord thy God, and Him only thou shalt serve.'
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he brought him to Jerusalem, and set him on the pinnacle of the temple, and said to him, `If the Son thou art of God, cast thyself down hence,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for it hath been written -- To His messengers He will give charge concerning thee, to guard over thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and -- On hands they shall bear thee up, lest at any time thou mayest dash against a stone thy foot.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answering said to him -- `It hath been said, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.'
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And having ended all temptation, the Devil departed from him till a convenient season.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus turned back in the power of the Spirit to Galilee, and a fame went forth through all the region round about concerning him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he was teaching in their synagogues, being glorified by all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came to Nazareth, where he hath been brought up, and he went in, according to his custom, on the sabbath-day, to the synagogue, and stood up to read;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there was given over to him a roll of Isaiah the prophet, and having unfolded the roll, he found the place where it hath been written:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The Spirit of the Lord [is] upon me, Because He did anoint me; To proclaim good news to the poor, Sent me to heal the broken of heart, To proclaim to captives deliverance, And to blind receiving of sight, To send away the bruised with deliverance,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: To proclaim the acceptable year of the Lord.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having folded the roll, having given [it] back to the officer, he sat down, and the eyes of all in the synagogue were gazing on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he began to say unto them -- `To-day hath this writing been fulfilled in your ears;'
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and all were bearing testimony to him, and were wondering at the gracious words that are coming forth out of his mouth, and they said, `Is not this the son of Joseph?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, `Certainly ye will say to me this simile, Physician, heal thyself; as great things as we heard done in Capernaum, do also here in thy country;'
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and he said, `Verily I say to you -- No prophet is accepted in his own country;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and of a truth I say to you, Many widows were in the days of Elijah, in Israel, when the heaven was shut for three years and six months, when great famine came on all the land,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and unto none of them was Elijah sent, but -- to Sarepta of Sidon, unto a woman, a widow;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and many lepers were in the time of Elisha the prophet, in Israel, and none of them was cleansed, but -- Naaman the Syrian.'
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And all in the synagogue were filled with wrath, hearing these things,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and having risen, they put him forth without the city, and brought him unto the brow of the hill on which their city had been built -- to cast him down headlong,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he, having gone through the midst of them, went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee, and was teaching them on the sabbaths,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were astonished at his teaching, because his word was with authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the synagogue was a man, having a spirit of an unclean demon, and he cried out with a great voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, `Away, what -- to us and to thee, Jesus, O Nazarene? thou didst come to destroy us; I have known thee who thou art -- the Holy One of God.'
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And Jesus did rebuke him, saying, `Be silenced, and come forth out of him;' and the demon having cast him into the midst, came forth from him, having hurt him nought;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and amazement came upon all, and they were speaking together, with one another, saying, `What [is] this word, that with authority and power he doth command the unclean spirits, and they come forth?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there was going forth a fame concerning him to every place of the region round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having risen out of the synagogue, he entered into the house of Simon, and the mother-in-law of Simon was pressed with a great fever, and they did ask him about her,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having stood over her, he rebuked the fever, and it left her, and presently, having risen, she was ministering to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at the setting of the sun, all, as many as had any ailing with manifold sicknesses, brought them unto him, and he on each one of them [his] hands having put, did heal them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And demons also were coming forth from many, crying out and saying -- `Thou art the Christ, the Son of God;' and rebuking, he did not suffer them to speak, because they knew him to be the Christ.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And day having come, having gone forth, he went on to a desert place, and the multitudes were seeking him, and they came unto him, and were staying him -- not to go on from them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said unto them -- `Also to the other cities it behoveth me to proclaim good news of the reign of God, because for this I have been sent;'
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and he was preaching in the synagogues of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, in the multitude pressing on him to hear the word of God, that he was standing beside the lake of Gennesaret,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he saw two boats standing beside the lake, and the fishers, having gone away from them, were washing the nets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having entered into one of the boats, that was Simon's, he asked him to put back a little from the land, and having sat down, was teaching the multitudes out of the boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he left off speaking, he said unto Simon, `Put back to the deep, and let down your nets for a draught;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Simon answering said to him, `Master, through the whole night, having laboured, we have taken nothing, but at thy saying I will let down the net.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having done this, they enclosed a great multitude of fishes, and their net was breaking,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they beckoned to the partners, who [are] in the other boat, having come, to help them; and they came, and filled both the boats, so that they were sinking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Simon Peter having seen, fell down at the knees of Jesus, saying, `Depart from me, because I am a sinful man, O lord;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for astonishment seized him, and all those with him, at the draught of the fishes that they took,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in like manner also James and John, sons of Zebedee, who were partners with Simon; and Jesus said unto Simon, `Fear not, henceforth thou shalt be catching men;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they, having brought the boats upon the land, having left all, did follow him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, in his being in one of the cities, that lo, a man full of leprosy, and having seen Jesus, having fallen on [his] face, he besought him, saying, `Sir, if thou mayest will, thou art able to cleanse me;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having stretched forth [his] hand, he touched him, having said, `I will; be thou cleansed;' and immediately the leprosy went away from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he charged him to tell no one, `But, having gone away, shew thyself to the priest, and bring near for thy cleansing according as Moses directed, for a testimony to them;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the more was the report going abroad concerning him, and great multitudes were coming together to hear, and to be healed by him of their infirmities,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he was withdrawing himself in the desert places and was praying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, on one of the days, that he was teaching, and there were sitting by Pharisees and teachers of the Law, who were come out of every village of Galilee, and Judea, and Jerusalem, and the power of the Lord was -- to heal them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And lo, men bearing upon a couch a man, who hath been struck with palsy, and they were seeking to bring him in, and to place before him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not having found by what way they may bring him in because of the multitude, having gone up on the house-top, through the tiles they let him down, with the little couch, into the midst before Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he having seen their faith, said to him, `Man, thy sins have been forgiven thee.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, `Who is this that doth speak evil words? who is able to forgive sins, except God only?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus having known their reasonings, answering, said unto them, `What reason ye in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which is easier -- to say, Thy sins have been forgiven thee? or to say, Arise, and walk?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And that ye may know that the Son of Man hath authority upon the earth to forgive sins -- (he said to the one struck with palsy) -- I say to thee, Arise, and having taken up thy little couch, be going on to thy house.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And presently having risen before them, having taken up [that] on which he was lying, he went away to his house, glorifying God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and astonishment took all, and they were glorifying God, and were filled with fear, saying -- `We saw strange things to-day.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after these things he went forth, and beheld a tax-gatherer, by name Levi, sitting at the tax-office, and said to him, `Be following me;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he, having left all, having arisen, did follow him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Levi made a great entertainment to him in his house, and there was a great multitude of tax-gatherers and others who were with them reclining (at meat),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the scribes and the Pharisees among them were murmuring at his disciples, saying, `Wherefore with tax-gatherers and sinners do ye eat and drink?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answering said unto them, `They who are well have no need of a physician, but they that are ill:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I came not to call righteous men, but sinners, to reformation.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said unto him, `Wherefore do the disciples of John fast often, and make supplications -- in like manner also those of the Pharisees -- but thine do eat and drink?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, `Are ye able to make the sons of the bride-chamber -- in the bridegroom being with them -- to fast?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but days will come, and, when the bridegroom may be taken away from them, then they shall fast in those days.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spake also a simile unto them -- `No one a patch of new clothing doth put on old clothing, and if otherwise, the new also doth make a rent, and with the old the patch doth not agree, that [is] from the new.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And no one doth put new wine into old skins, and if otherwise, the new wine will burst the skins, and itself will be poured out, and the skins will be destroyed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but new wine into new skins is to be put, and both are preserved together;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and no one having drunk old [wine], doth immediately wish new, for he saith, The old is better.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, on the second-first sabbath, as he is going through the corn fields, that his disciples were plucking the ears, and were eating, rubbing with the hands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and certain of the Pharisees said to them, `Why do ye that which is not lawful to do on the sabbaths?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answering said unto them, `Did ye not read even this that David did, when he hungered, himself and those who are with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how he went into the house of God, and the loaves of the presentation did take, and did eat, and gave also to those with him, which it is not lawful to eat, except only to the priests?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to them, -- `The Son of Man is lord also of the sabbath.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass also, on another sabbath, that he goeth into the synagogue, and teacheth, and there was there a man, and his right hand was withered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the scribes and the Pharisees were watching him, if on the sabbath he will heal, that they might find an accusation against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he himself had known their reasonings, and said to the man having the withered hand, `Rise, and stand in the midst;' and he having risen, stood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Jesus unto them, `I will question you something: Is it lawful on the sabbaths to do good, or to do evil? life to save or to kill?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having looked round on them all, he said to the man, `Stretch forth thy hand;' and he did so, and his hand was restored whole as the other;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were filled with madness, and were speaking with one another what they might do to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass in those days, he went forth to the mountain to pray, and was passing the night in the prayer of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when it became day, he called near his disciples, and having chosen from them twelve, whom also he named apostles,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Simon, whom also he named Peter, and Andrew his brother, James and John, Philip and Bartholomew,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Matthew and Thomas, James of Alphaeus, and Simon called Zelotes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas of James, and Judas Iscariot, who also became betrayer;)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having come down with them, he stood upon a level spot, and a crowd of his disciples, and a great multitude of the people from all Judea, and Jerusalem, and the maritime Tyre and Sidon, who came to hear him, and to be healed of their sicknesses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and those harassed by unclean spirits, and they were healed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the multitude were seeking to touch him, because power from him was going forth, and he was healing all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he, having lifted up his eyes to his disciples, said: `Happy the poor -- because yours is the reign of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Happy those hungering now -- because ye shall be filled. `Happy those weeping now -- because ye shall laugh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Happy are ye when men shall hate you, and when they shall separate you, and shall reproach, and shall cast forth your name as evil, for the Son of Man's sake --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: rejoice in that day, and leap, for lo, your reward [is] great in the heaven, for according to these things were their fathers doing to the prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `But wo to you -- the rich, because ye have got your comfort.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Wo to you who have been filled -- because ye shall hunger. `Wo to you who are laughing now -- because ye shall mourn and weep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Wo to you when all men shall speak well of you -- for according to these things were their fathers doing to false prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `But I say to you who are hearing, Love your enemies, do good to those hating you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: bless those cursing you, and pray for those accusing you falsely;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to him smiting thee upon the cheek, give also the other, and from him taking away from thee the mantle, also the coat thou mayest not keep back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And to every one who is asking of thee, be giving; and from him who is taking away thy goods, be not asking again;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and as ye wish that men may do to you, do ye also to them in like manner;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and -- if ye love those loving you, what grace have ye? for also the sinful love those loving them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if ye do good to those doing good to you, what grace have ye? for also the sinful do the same;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if ye lend [to those] of whom ye hope to receive back, what grace have ye? for also the sinful lend to sinners -- that they may receive again as much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, hoping for nothing again, and your reward will be great, and ye shall be sons of the Highest, because He is kind unto the ungracious and evil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: be ye therefore merciful, as also your Father is merciful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And judge not, and ye may not be judged; condemn not, and ye may not be condemned; release, and ye shall be released.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Give, and it shall be given to you; good measure, pressed, and shaken, and running over, they shall give into your bosom; for with that measure with which ye measure, it shall be measured to you again.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spake a simile to them, `Is blind able to lead blind? shall they not both fall into a pit?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A disciple is not above his teacher, but every one perfected shall be as his teacher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And why dost thou behold the mote that is in thy brother's eye, and the beam that [is] in thine own eye dost not consider?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or how art thou able to say to thy brother, Brother, suffer, I may take out the mote that [is] in thine eye -- thyself the beam in thine own eye not beholding? Hypocrite, take first the beam out of thine own eye, and then thou shalt see clearly to take out the mote that [is] in thy brother's eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `For there is not a good tree making bad fruit, nor a bad tree making good fruit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for each tree from its own fruit is known, for not from thorns do they gather figs, nor from a bramble do they crop a grape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The good man out of the good treasure of his heart doth bring forth that which [is] good; and the evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart doth bring forth that which [is] evil; for out of the abounding of the heart doth his mouth speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And why do ye call me, Lord, Lord, and do not what I say?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every one who is coming unto me, and is hearing my words, and is doing them, I will shew you to whom he is like;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he is like to a man building a house, who did dig, and deepen, and laid a foundation upon the rock, and a flood having come, the stream broke forth on that house, and was not able to shake it, for it had been founded upon the rock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he who heard and did not, is like to a man having builded a house upon the earth, without a foundation, against which the stream brake forth, and immediately it fell, and the ruin of that house became great.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he completed all his sayings in the ears of the people, he went into Capernaum;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a certain centurion's servant being ill, was about to die, who was much valued by him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having heard about Jesus, he sent unto him elders of the Jews, beseeching him, that having come he might thoroughly save his servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they, having come near unto Jesus, were calling upon him earnestly, saying -- `He is worthy to whom thou shalt do this,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he doth love our nation, and the synagogue he did build to us.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus was going on with them, and now when he is not far distant from the house the centurion sent unto him friends, saying to him, `Sir, be not troubled, for I am not worthy that under my roof thou mayest enter;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: wherefore not even myself thought I worthy to come unto thee, but say in a word, and my lad shall be healed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I also am a man placed under authority, having under myself soldiers, and I say to this [one], Go, and he goeth; and to another, Be coming, and he cometh; and to my servant, Do this, and he doth [it].'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having heard these things Jesus wondered at him, and having turned to the multitude following him, he said, `I say to you, not even in Israel so much faith did I find;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and those sent, having turned back to the house, found the ailing servant in health.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, on the morrow, he was going on to a city called Nain, and there were going with him many of his disciples, and a great multitude,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and as he came nigh to the gate of the city, then, lo, one dead was being carried forth, an only son of his mother, and she a widow, and a great multitude of the city was with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord having seen her, was moved with compassion towards her, and said to her, `Be not weeping;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having come near, he touched the bier, and those bearing [it] stood still, and he said, `Young man, to thee I say, Arise;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the dead sat up, and began to speak, and he gave him to his mother;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and fear took hold of all, and they were glorifying God, saying -- `A great prophet hath risen among us,' and -- `God did look upon His people.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the account of this went forth in all Judea about him, and in all the region around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the disciples of John told him about all these things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and John having called near a certain two of his disciples, sent unto Jesus, saying, `Art thou he who is coming, or for another do we look?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having come near to him, the men said, `John the Baptist sent us unto thee, saying, Art thou he who is coming, or for another do we look?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in that hour he cured many from sicknesses, and plagues, and evil spirits, and to many blind he granted sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answering said to them, `Having gone on, report to John what ye saw and heard, that blind men do see again, lame do walk, lepers are cleansed, deaf do hear, dead are raised, poor have good news proclaimed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and happy is he whoever may not be stumbled in me.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the messengers of John having gone away, he began to say unto the multitudes concerning John: `What have ye gone forth to the wilderness to look on? a reed by the wind shaken?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but what have ye gone forth to see? a man in soft garments clothed? lo, they in splendid apparellings, and living in luxury, are in the houses of kings!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `But what have ye gone forth to see? a prophet? Yes, I say to you, and much more than a prophet:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this is he concerning whom it hath been written, Lo, I send my messenger before thy face, who shall prepare thy way before thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I say to you, a greater prophet, among those born of women, than John the Baptist there is not; but the least in the reign of God is greater than he.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people having heard, and the tax-gatherers, declared God righteous, having been baptized with the baptism of John,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the Pharisees, and the lawyers, the counsel of God did put away for themselves, not having been baptized by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, `To what, then, shall I liken the men of this generation? and to what are they like?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they are like to children, to those sitting in a market-place, and calling one to another, and saying, We piped to you, and ye did not dance, we mourned to you, and ye did not weep!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine, and ye say, He hath a demon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Son of Man came eating and drinking, and ye say, Lo, a man, a glutton, and a wine drinker, a friend of tax-gatherers and sinners;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the wisdom was justified from all her children.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain one of the Pharisees was asking him that he might eat with him, and having gone into the house of the Pharisee he reclined (at meat),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and lo, a woman in the city, who was a sinner, having known that he reclineth (at meat) in the house of the Pharisee, having provided an alabaster box of ointment,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having stood behind, beside his feet, weeping, she began to wet his feet with the tears, and with the hairs of her head she was wiping, and was kissing his feet, and was anointing with the ointment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Pharisee who did call him, having seen, spake within himself, saying, `This one, if he were a prophet, would have known who and of what kind [is] the woman who doth touch him, that she is a sinner.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answering said unto him, `Simon, I have something to say to thee;' and he saith, `Teacher, say on.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Two debtors were to a certain creditor; the one was owing five hundred denaries, and the other fifty;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they not having [wherewith] to give back, he forgave both; which then of them, say thou, will love him more?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Simon answering said, `I suppose that to whom he forgave the more;' and he said to him, `Rightly thou didst judge.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having turned unto the woman, he said to Simon, `Seest thou this woman? I entered into thy house; water for my feet thou didst not give, but this woman with tears did wet my feet, and with the hairs of her head did wipe;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a kiss to me thou didst not give, but this woman, from what [time] I came in, did not cease kissing my feet;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with oil my head thou didst not anoint, but this woman with ointment did anoint my feet;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore I say to thee, her many sins have been forgiven, because she did love much; but to whom little is forgiven, little he doth love.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to her, `Thy sins have been forgiven;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and those reclining with him (at meat) began to say within themselves, `Who is this, who also doth forgive sins?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said unto the woman, `Thy faith have saved thee, be going on to peace.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass thereafter, that he was going through every city and village, preaching and proclaiming good news of the reign of God, and the twelve [are] with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and certain women, who were healed of evil spirits and infirmities, Mary who is called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone forth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Joanna wife of Chuza, steward of Herod, and Susanna, and many others, who were ministering to him from their substance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a great multitude having gathered, and those who from city and city were coming unto him, he spake by a simile:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The sower went forth to sow his seed, and in his sowing some indeed fell beside the way, and it was trodden down, and the fowls of the heaven did devour it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And other fell upon the rock, and having sprung up, it did wither, through not having moisture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And other fell amidst the thorns, and the thorns having sprung up with it, did choke it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And other fell upon the good ground, and having sprung up, it made fruit an hundred fold.' These things saying, he was calling, `He having ears to hear -- let him hear.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his disciples were questioning him, saying, `What may this simile be?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, `To you it hath been given to know the secrets of the reign of God, and to the rest in similes; that seeing they may not see, and hearing they may not understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And this is the simile: The seed is the word of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and those beside the way are those hearing, then cometh the Devil, and taketh up the word from their heart, lest having believed, they may be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And those upon the rock: They who, when they may hear, with joy do receive the word, and these have no root, who for a time believe, and in time of temptation fall away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And that which fell to the thorns: These are they who have heard, and going forth, through anxieties, and riches, and pleasures of life, are choked, and bear not to completion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And that in the good ground: These are they, who in an upright and good heart, having heard the word, do retain [it], and bear fruit in continuance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And no one having lighted a lamp doth cover it with a vessel, or under a couch doth put [it]; but upon a lamp-stand he doth put [it], that those coming in may see the light,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for nothing is secret, that shall not become manifest, nor hid, that shall not be known, and become manifest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `See, therefore, how ye hear, for whoever may have, there shall be given to him, and whoever may not have, also what he seemeth to have, shall be taken from him.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there came unto him his mother and brethren, and they were not able to get to him because of the multitude,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it was told him, saying, `Thy mother and thy brethren do stand without, wishing to see thee;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he answering said unto them, `My mother and my brethren! they are those who the word of God are hearing, and doing.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, on one of the days, that he himself went into a boat with his disciples, and he said unto them, `We may go over to the other side of the lake;' and they set forth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and as they are sailing he fell deeply asleep, and there came down a storm of wind to the lake, and they were filling, and were in peril.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having come near, they awoke him, saying, `Master, master, we perish;' and he, having arisen, rebuked the wind and the raging of the water, and they ceased, and there came a calm,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to them, `Where is your faith?' and they being afraid did wonder, saying unto one another, `Who, then, is this, that even the winds he doth command, and the water, and they obey him?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they sailed down to the region of the Gadarenes, that is over-against Galilee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he having gone forth upon the land, there met him a certain man, out of the city, who had demons for a long time, and with a garment was not clothed, and in a house was not abiding, but in the tombs,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having seen Jesus, and having cried out, he fell before him, and with a loud voice, said, `What -- to me and to thee, Jesus, Son of God Most High? I beseech thee, mayest thou not afflict me!'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he commanded the unclean spirit to come forth from the man, for many times it had caught him, and he was being bound with chains and fetters -- guarded, and breaking asunder the bonds he was driven by the demons to the deserts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus questioned him, saying, `What is thy name?' and he said, `Legion,' (because many demons were entered into him,)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he was calling on him, that he may not command them to go away to the abyss,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there was there a herd of many swine feeding in the mountain, and they were calling on him, that he might suffer them to enter into these, and he suffered them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the demons having gone forth from the man, did enter into the swine, and the herd rushed down the steep to the lake, and were choked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those feeding [them], having seen what was come to pass, fled, and having gone, told [it] to the city, and to the fields;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they came forth to see what was come to pass, and they came unto Jesus, and found the man sitting, out of whom the demons had gone forth, clothed, and right-minded, at the feet of Jesus, and they were afraid;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and those also having seen [it], told them how the demoniac was saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the whole multitude of the region of the Gadarenes round about asked him to go away from them, because with great fear they were pressed, and he having entered into the boat, did turn back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man from whom the demons had gone forth was beseeching of him to be with him, and Jesus sent him away, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Turn back to thy house, and tell how great things God did to thee;' and he went away through all the city proclaiming how great things Jesus did to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, in the turning back of Jesus, the multitude received him, for they were all looking for him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and lo, there came a man, whose name [is] Jairus, and he was a chief of the synagogue, and having fallen at the feet of Jesus, was calling on him to come to his house;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he had an only daughter about twelve years [old], and she was dying. And in his going away, the multitudes were thronging him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a woman, having an issue of blood for twelve years, who, having spent on physicians all her living, was not able to be healed by any,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having come near behind, touched the fringe of his garment, and presently the issue of her blood stood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said, `Who [is] it that touched me?' and all denying, Peter and those with him said, `Master, the multitudes press thee, and throng [thee], and thou dost say, Who [is] it that touched me!'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said, `Some one did touch me, for I knew power having gone forth from me.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the woman, having seen that she was not hid, trembling, came, and having fallen before him, for what cause she touched him declared to him before all the people, and how she was healed presently;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to her, `Take courage, daughter, thy faith hath saved thee, be going on to peace.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he is yet speaking, there doth come a certain one from the chief of the synagogue's [house], saying to him -- `Thy daughter hath died, harass not the Teacher;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus having heard, answered him, saying, `Be not afraid, only believe, and she shall be saved.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having come to the house, he suffered no one to go in, except Peter, and James, and John, and the father of the child, and the mother;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were all weeping, and beating themselves for her, and he said, `Weep not, she did not die, but doth sleep;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were deriding him, knowing that she did die;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he having put all forth without, and having taken hold of her hand, called, saying, `Child, arise;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and her spirit came back, and she arose presently, and he directed that there be given to her to eat;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and her parents were amazed, but he charged them to say to no one what was come to pass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having called together his twelve disciples, he gave them power and authority over all the demons, and to cure sicknesses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he sent them to proclaim the reign of God, and to heal the ailing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, `Take nothing for the way, neither staff, nor scrip, nor bread, nor money; neither have two coats each;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and into whatever house ye may enter, there remain, and thence depart;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and as many as may not receive you, going forth from that city, even the dust from your feet shake off, for a testimony against them.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And going forth they were going through the several villages, proclaiming good news, and healing everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Herod the tetrarch heard of all the things being done by him, and was perplexed, because it was said by certain, that John hath been raised out of the dead;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and by certain, that Elijah did appear, and by others, that a prophet, one of the ancients, was risen;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Herod said, `John I did behead, but who is this concerning whom I hear such things?' and he was seeking to see him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the apostles having turned back, declared to him how great things they did, and having taken them, he withdrew by himself to a desert place of a city called Bethsaida,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the multitudes having known did follow him, and having received them, he was speaking to them concerning the reign of God, and those having need of service he cured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the day began to decline, and the twelve having come near, said to him, `Let away the multitude, that having gone to the villages and the fields round about, they may lodge and may find provision, because here we are in a desert place.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, `Give ye them to eat;' and they said, `We have no more than five loaves, and two fishes: except, having gone, we may buy for all this people victuals;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they were about five thousand men. And he said unto his disciples, `Cause them to recline in companies, in each fifty;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they did so, and made all to recline;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having taken the five loaves, and the two fishes, having looked up to the heaven, he blessed them, and brake, and was giving to the disciples to set before the multitude;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they did eat, and were all filled, and there was taken up what was over to them of broken pieces, twelve baskets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, as he is praying alone, the disciples were with him, and he questioned them, saying, `Who do the multitudes say me to be?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they answering said, `John the Baptist; and others, Elijah; and others, that a prophet, one of the ancients, was risen;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to them, `And ye -- who do ye say me to be?' and Peter answering said, `The Christ of God.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having charged them, he commanded [them] to say this to no one,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying -- `It behoveth the Son of Man to suffer many things, and to be rejected by the elders, and chief priests, and scribes, and to be killed, and the third day to be raised.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto all, `If any one doth will to come after me, let him disown himself, and take up his cross daily, and follow me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for whoever may will to save his life, shall lose it, and whoever may lose his life for my sake, he shall save it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for what is a man profited, having gained the whole world, and having lost or having forfeited himself?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `For whoever may be ashamed of me, and of my words, of this one shall the Son of Man be ashamed, when he may come in his glory, and the Father's, and the holy messengers';
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I say to you, truly, there are certain of those here standing, who shall not taste of death till they may see the reign of God.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, after these words, as it were eight days, that having taken Peter, and John, and James, he went up to the mountain to pray,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it came to pass, in his praying, the appearance of his face became altered, and his garment white -- sparkling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And lo, two men were speaking together with him, who were Moses and Elijah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who having appeared in glory, spake of his outgoing that he was about to fulfil in Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but Peter and those with him were heavy with sleep, and having waked, they saw his glory, and the two men standing with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, in their parting from him, Peter said unto Jesus, `Master, it is good to us to be here; and we may make three booths, one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah,' not knowing what he saith:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and as he was speaking these things, there came a cloud, and overshadowed them, and they feared in their entering into the cloud,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a voice came out of the cloud saying, `This is My Son -- the Beloved; hear ye him;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when the voice was past, Jesus was found alone; and they were silent, and declared to no one in those days anything of what they have seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass on the next day, they having come down from the mount, there met him a great multitude,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and lo, a man from the multitude cried out, saying, `Teacher, I beseech thee, look upon my son, because he is my only begotten;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and lo, a spirit doth take him, and suddenly he doth cry out, and it teareth him, with foaming, and it hardly departeth from him, bruising him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I besought thy disciples that they might cast it out, and they were not able.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answering said, `O generation, unstedfast and perverse, till when shall I be with you, and suffer you? bring near hither thy son;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and as he is yet coming near, the demon rent him, and tore [him] sore, and Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed the youth, and gave him back to his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were all amazed at the greatness of God, and while all are wondering at all things that Jesus did, he said unto his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Lay ye to your ears these words, for the Son of Man is about to be delivered up to the hands of men.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were not knowing this saying, and it was veiled from them, that they might not perceive it, and they were afraid to ask him about this saying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there entered a reasoning among them, this, Who may be greater of them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus having seen the reasoning of their heart, having taken hold of a child, set him beside himself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, `Whoever may receive this child in my name, doth receive me, and whoever may receive me, doth receive Him who sent me, for he who is least among you all -- he shall be great.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And John answering said, `Master, we saw a certain one in thy name casting forth the demons, and we forbade him, because he doth not follow with us;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus said unto him, `Forbid not, for he who is not against us, is for us.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, in the completing of the days of his being taken up, that he fixed his face to go on to Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he sent messengers before his face, and having gone on, they went into a village of Samaritans, to make ready for him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they did not receive him, because his face was going on to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his disciples James and John having seen, said, `Sir, wilt thou [that] we may command fire to come down from the heaven, and to consume them, as also Elijah did?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having turned, he rebuked them, and said, `Ye have not known of what spirit ye are;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the Son of Man did not come to destroy men's lives, but to save;' and they went on to another village.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, as they are going on in the way, a certain one said unto him, `I will follow thee wherever thou mayest go, sir;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus said to him, `The foxes have holes, and the fowls of the heaven places of rest, but the Son of Man hath not where he may recline the head.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto another, `Be following me;' and he said, `Sir, permit me, having gone away, first to bury my father;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus said to him, `Suffer the dead to bury their own dead, and thou, having gone away, publish the reign of God.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And another also said, `I will follow thee, sir, but first permit me to take leave of those in my house;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus said unto him, `No one having put his hand on a plough, and looking back, is fit for the reign of God.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after these things, the Lord did appoint also other seventy, and sent them by twos before his face, to every city and place whither he himself was about to come,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then said he unto them, `The harvest indeed [is] abundant, but the workmen few; beseech ye then the Lord of the harvest, that He may put forth workmen to His harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Go away; lo, I send you forth as lambs in the midst of wolves;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: carry no bag, no scrip, nor sandals; and salute no one on the way;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and into whatever house ye do enter, first say, Peace to this house;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if indeed there may be there the son of peace, rest on it shall your peace; and if not so, upon you it shall turn back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And in that house remain, eating and drinking the things they have, for worthy [is] the workman of his hire; go not from house to house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and into whatever city ye enter, and they may receive you, eat the things set before you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and heal the ailing in it, and say to them, The reign of God hath come nigh to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And into whatever city ye do enter, and they may not receive you, having gone forth to its broad places, say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the dust that hath cleaved to us, from your city, we do wipe off against you, but this know ye, that the reign of God hath come nigh to you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I say to you, that for Sodom in that day it shall be more tolerable than for that city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Wo to thee, Chorazin; wo to thee, Bethsaida; for if in Tyre and Sidon had been done the mighty works that were done in you, long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes, they had reformed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but for Tyre and Sidon it shall be more tolerable in the judgment than for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou, Capernaum, which unto the heaven wast exalted, unto hades thou shalt be brought down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `He who is hearing you, doth hear me; and he who is putting you away, doth put me away; and he who is putting me away, doth put away Him who sent me.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the seventy turned back with joy, saying, `Sir, and the demons are being subjected to us in thy name;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to them, `I was beholding the Adversary, as lightning from the heaven having fallen;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lo, I give to you the authority to tread upon serpents and scorpions, and on all the power of the enemy, and nothing by any means shall hurt you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but, in this rejoice not, that the spirits are subjected to you, but rejoice rather that your names were written in the heavens.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that hour was Jesus glad in the Spirit, and said, `I do confess to thee, Father, Lord of the heaven and of the earth, that Thou didst hide these things from wise men and understanding, and didst reveal them to babes; yes, Father, because so it became good pleasure before Thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `All things were delivered up to me by my Father, and no one doth know who the Son is, except the Father, and who the Father is, except the Son, and he to whom the Son may wish to reveal [Him].'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having turned unto the disciples, he said, by themselves, `Happy the eyes that are perceiving what ye perceive;
verses.speaker: Narrator
