verses.text: for I say to you, that many prophets and kings did wish to see what ye perceive, and did not see, and to hear what ye hear, and did not hear.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And lo, a certain lawyer stood up, trying him, and saying, `Teacher, what having done, life age-during shall I inherit?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto him, `In the law what hath been written? how dost thou read?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answering said, `Thou shalt love the Lord thy God out of all thy heart, and out of all thy soul, and out of all thy strength, and out of all thy understanding, and thy neighbour as thyself.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, `Rightly thou didst answer; this do, and thou shalt live.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he, willing to declare himself righteous, said unto Jesus, `And who is my neighbour?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus having taken up [the word], said, `A certain man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and fell among robbers, and having stripped him and inflicted blows, they went away, leaving [him] half dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And by a coincidence a certain priest was going down in that way, and having seen him, he passed over on the opposite side;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in like manner also, a Levite, having been about the place, having come and seen, passed over on the opposite side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `But a certain Samaritan, journeying, came along him, and having seen him, he was moved with compassion,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having come near, he bound up his wounds, pouring on oil and wine, and having lifted him up on his own beast, he brought him to an inn, and was careful of him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and on the morrow, going forth, taking out two denaries, he gave to the innkeeper, and said to him, Be careful of him, and whatever thou mayest spend more, I, in my coming again, will give back to thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Who, then, of these three, seemeth to thee to have become neighbour of him who fell among the robbers?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, `He who did the kindness with him,' then Jesus said to him, `Be going on, and thou be doing in like manner.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, in their going on, that he entered into a certain village, and a certain woman, by name Martha, did receive him into her house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and she had also a sister, called Mary, who also, having seated herself beside the feet of Jesus, was hearing the word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Martha was distracted about much serving, and having stood by him, she said, `Sir, dost thou not care that my sister left me alone to serve? say then to her, that she may partake along with me.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answering said to her, `Martha, Martha, thou art anxious and disquieted about many things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but of one thing there is need, and Mary the good part did choose, that shall not be taken away from her.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, in his being in a certain place praying, as he ceased, a certain one of his disciples said unto him, `Sir, teach us to pray, as also John taught his disciples.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, `When ye may pray, say ye: Our Father who art in the heavens; hallowed be Thy name: Thy reign come; Thy will come to pass, as in heaven also on earth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: our appointed bread be giving us daily;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and forgive us our sins, for also we ourselves forgive every one indebted to us; and mayest Thou not bring us into temptation; but do Thou deliver us from the evil.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, `Who of you shall have a friend, and shall go on unto him at midnight, and may say to him, Friend, lend me three loaves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: seeing a friend of mine came out of the way unto me, and I have not what I shall set before him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he from within answering may say, Do not give me trouble, already the door hath been shut, and my children with me are in the bed, I am not able, having risen, to give to thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `I say to you, even if he will not give to him, having risen, because of his being his friend, yet because of his importunity, having risen, he will give him as many as he doth need;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I say to you, Ask, and it shall be given to you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened to you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for every one who is asking doth receive; and he who is seeking doth find; and to him who is knocking it shall be opened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And of which of you -- the father -- if the son shall ask a loaf, a stone will he present to him? and if a fish, will he instead of a fish, a serpent present to him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if he may ask an egg, will he present to him a scorpion?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If, then, ye, being evil, have known good gifts to be giving to your children, how much more shall the Father who is from heaven give the Holy Spirit to those asking Him!'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was casting forth a demon, and it was dumb, and it came to pass, the demon having gone forth, the dumb man spake, and the multitudes wondered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and certain of them said, `By Beelzeboul, ruler of the demons, he doth cast forth the demons;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and others, tempting, a sign out of heaven from him were asking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he, knowing their thoughts, said to them, `Every kingdom having been divided against itself is desolated; and house against house doth fall;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if also the Adversary against himself was divided, how shall his kingdom be made to stand? for ye say, by Beelzeboul is my casting forth the demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `But if I by Beelzeboul cast forth the demons -- your sons, by whom do they cast forth? because of this your judges they shall be;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if by the finger of God I cast forth the demons, then come unawares upon you did the reign of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When the strong man armed may keep his hall, in peace are his goods;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when the stronger than he, having come upon [him], may overcome him, his whole-armour he doth take away in which he had trusted, and his spoils he distributeth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he who is not with me is against me, and he who is not gathering with me doth scatter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When the unclean spirit may go forth from the man it walketh through waterless places seeking rest, and not finding, it saith, I will turn back to my house whence I came forth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having come, it findeth [it] swept and adorned;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then doth it go, and take to it seven other spirits more evil than itself, and having entered, they dwell there, and the last of that man becometh worst than the first.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, in his saying these things, a certain woman having lifted up the voice out of the multitude, said to him, `Happy the womb that carried thee, and the paps that thou didst suck!'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, `Yea, rather, happy those hearing the word of God, and keeping [it]!'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the multitudes crowding together upon him, he began to say, `This generation is evil, a sign it doth seek after, and a sign shall not be given to it, except the sign of Jonah the prophet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for as Jonah became a sign to the Ninevites, so also shall the Son of Man be to this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `A queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation, and shall condemn them, because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and lo, greater than Solomon here!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Men of Nineveh shall stand up in the judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it, because they reformed at the proclamation of Jonah; and lo, greater than Jonah here!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And no one having lighted a lamp, doth put [it] in a secret place, nor under the measure, but on the lamp-stand, that those coming in may behold the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The lamp of the body is the eye, when then thine eye may be simple, thy whole body also is lightened; and when it may be evil, thy body also is darkened;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: take heed, then, lest the light that [is] in thee be darkness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if then thy whole body is lightened, not having any part darkened, the whole shall be lightened, as when the lamp by the brightness may give thee light.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in [his] speaking, a certain Pharisee was asking him that he might dine with him, and having gone in, he reclined (at meat),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Pharisee having seen, did wonder that he did not first baptize himself before the dinner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said unto him, `Now do ye, the Pharisees, the outside of the cup and of the plate make clean, but your inward part is full of rapine and wickedness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: unthinking! did not He who made the outside also the inside make?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what ye have give ye [as] alms, and, lo, all things are clean to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `But wo to you, the Pharisees, because ye tithe the mint, and the rue, and every herb, and ye pass by the judgment, and the love of God; these things it behoveth to do, and those not to be neglecting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Wo to you, the Pharisees, because ye love the first seats in the synagogues, and the salutations in the market-places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Wo to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, because ye are as the unseen tombs, and the men walking above have not known.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of the lawyers answering, saith to him, `Teacher, these things saying, us also thou dost insult;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, `And to you, the lawyers, wo! because ye burden men with burdens grievous to be borne, and ye yourselves with one of your fingers do not touch the burdens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Wo to you, because ye build the tombs of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then do ye testify, and are well pleased with the works of your fathers, because they indeed killed them, and ye do build their tombs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because of this also the wisdom of God said: I will send to them prophets, and apostles, and some of them they shall kill and persecute,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the blood of all the prophets, that is being poured forth from the foundation of the world, may be required from this generation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the blood of Abel unto the blood of Zacharias, who perished between the altar and the house; yes, I say to you, It shall be required from this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Wo to you, the lawyers, because ye took away the key of the knowledge; yourselves ye did not enter; and those coming in, ye did hinder.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in his speaking these things unto them, the scribes and the Pharisees began fearfully to urge and to press him to speak about many things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: laying wait for him, and seeking to catch something out of his mouth, that they might accuse him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At which time the myriads of the multitude having been gathered together, so as to tread upon one another, he began to say unto his disciples, first, `Take heed to yourselves of the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there is nothing covered, that shall not be revealed; and hid, that shall not be known;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because whatever in the darkness ye said, in the light shall be heard: and what to the ear ye spake in the inner-chambers, shall be proclaimed upon the house-tops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And I say to you, my friends, be not afraid of those killing the body, and after these things are not having anything over to do;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I will show to you, whom ye may fear; Fear him who, after the killing, is having authority to cast to the gehenna; yes, I say to you, Fear ye Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Are not five sparrows sold for two assars? and one of them is not forgotten before God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but even the hairs of your head have been all numbered; therefore fear ye not, than many sparrows ye are of more value.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And I say to you, Every one -- whoever may confess with me before men, the Son of Man also shall confess with him before the messengers of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he who hath denied me before men, shall be denied before the messengers of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and every one whoever shall say a word to the Son of Man, it shall be forgiven to him, but to him who to the Holy Spirit did speak evil, it shall not be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when they bring you before the synagogues, and the rulers, and the authorities, be not anxious how or what ye may reply, or what ye may say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the Holy Spirit shall teach you in that hour what it behoveth [you] to say.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain one said to him, out of the multitude, `Teacher, say to my brother to divide with me the inheritance.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, `Man, who set me a judge or a divider over you?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, `Observe, and beware of the covetousness, because not in the abundance of one's goods is his life.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spake a simile unto them, saying, `Of a certain rich man the field brought forth well;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he was reasoning within himself, saying, What shall I do, because I have not where I shall gather together my fruits?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, This I will do, I will take down my storehouses, and greater ones I will build, and I will gather together there all my products and my good things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I will say to my soul, Soul, thou hast many good things laid up for many years, be resting, eat, drink, be merry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And God said to him, Unthinking one! this night thy soul they shall require from thee, and what things thou didst prepare -- to whom shall they be?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so [is] he who is treasuring up to himself, and is not rich toward God.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto his disciples, `Because of this, to you I say, Be not anxious for your life, what ye may eat; nor for the body, what ye may put on;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the life is more than the nourishment, and the body than the clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Consider the ravens, that they sow not, nor reap, to which there is no barn nor storehouse, and God doth nourish them; how much better are ye than the fowls?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and who of you, being anxious, is able to add to his age one cubit?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If, then, ye are not able for the least -- why for the rest are ye anxious?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Consider the lilies, how do they grow? they labour not, nor do they spin, and I say to you, not even Solomon in all his glory was arrayed as one of these;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if the herbage in the field, that to-day is, and to-morrow into an oven is cast, God doth so clothe, how much more you -- ye of little faith?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And ye -- seek not what ye may eat, or what ye may drink, and be not in suspense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for all these things do the nations of the world seek after, and your Father hath known that ye have need of these things;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but, seek ye the reign of God, and all these things shall be added to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Fear not, little flock, because your Father did delight to give you the reign;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: sell your goods, and give alms, make to yourselves bags that become not old, a treasure unfailing in the heavens, where thief doth not come near, nor moth destroy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for where your treasure is, there also your heart will be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Let your loins be girded, and the lamps burning,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye like to men waiting for their lord, when he shall return out of the wedding feasts, that he having come and knocked, immediately they may open to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Happy those servants, whom the lord, having come, shall find watching; verily I say to you, that he will gird himself, and will cause them to recline (at meat), and having come near, will minister to them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if he may come in the second watch, and in the third watch he may come, and may find [it] so, happy are those servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And this know, that if the master of the house had known what hour the thief doth come, he would have watched, and would not have suffered his house to be broken through;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye, then, become ye ready, because at the hour ye think not, the Son of Man doth come.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter said to him, `Sir, unto us this simile dost thou speak, or also unto all?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, `Who, then, is the faithful and prudent steward whom the lord shall set over his household, to give in season the wheat measure?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Happy that servant, whom his lord, having come, shall find doing so;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: truly I say to you, that over all his goods he will set him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if that servant may say in his heart, My lord doth delay to come, and may begin to beat the men-servants and the maid-servants, to eat also, and to drink, and to be drunken;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the lord of that servant will come in a day in which he doth not look for [him], and in an hour that he doth not know, and will cut him off, and his portion with the unfaithful he will appoint.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And that servant, who having known his lord's will, and not having prepared, nor having gone according to his will, shall be beaten with many stripes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he who, not having known, and having done things worthy of stripes, shall be beaten with few; and to every one to whom much was given, much shall be required from him; and to whom they did commit much, more abundantly they will ask of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Fire I came to cast to the earth, and what will I if already it was kindled?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I have a baptism to be baptized with, and how am I pressed till it may be completed!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Think ye that peace I came to give in the earth? no, I say to you, but rather division;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for there shall be henceforth five in one house divided -- three against two, and two against three;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a father shall be divided against a son, and a son against a father, a mother against a daughter, and a daughter against a mother, a mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said also to the multitudes, `When ye may see the cloud rising from the west, immediately ye say, A shower doth come, and it is so;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when -- a south wind blowing, ye say, that there will be heat, and it is;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: hypocrites! the face of the earth and of the heaven ye have known to make proof of, but this time -- how do ye not make proof of [it]?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And why, also, of yourselves, judge ye not what is righteous?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for, as thou art going away with thy opponent to the ruler, in the way give diligence to be released from him, lest he may drag thee unto the judge, and the judge may deliver thee to the officer, and the officer may cast thee into prison;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say to thee, thou mayest not come forth thence till even the last mite thou mayest give back.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were present certain at that time, telling him about the Galileans, whose blood Pilate did mingle with their sacrifices;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus answering said to them, `Think ye that these Galileans became sinners beyond all the Galileans, because they have suffered such things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No -- I say to you, but, if ye may not reform, all ye even so shall perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Or those eighteen, on whom the tower in Siloam fell, and killed them; think ye that these became debtors beyond all men who are dwelling in Jerusalem?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No -- I say to you, but, if ye may not reform, all ye in like manner shall perish.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spake this simile: `A certain one had a fig-tree planted in his vineyard, and he came seeking fruit in it, and he did not find;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said unto the vine-dresser, Lo, three years I come seeking fruit in this fig-tree, and do not find, cut it off, why also the ground doth it render useless?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he answering saith to him, Sir, suffer it also this year, till that I may dig about it, and cast in dung;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if indeed it may bear fruit --; and if not so, thereafter thou shalt cut it off.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the sabbath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and lo, there was a woman having a spirit of infirmity eighteen years, and she was bowed together, and not able to bend back at all,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus having seen her, did call [her] near, and said to her, `Woman, thou hast been loosed from thy infirmity;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he laid on her [his] hands, and presently she was set upright, and was glorifying God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chief of the synagogue answering -- much displeased that on the sabbath Jesus healed -- said to the multitude, `Six days there are in which it behoveth [us] to be working; in these, then, coming, be healed, and not on the sabbath-day.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord answered him and said, `Hypocrite, doth not each of you on the sabbath loose his ox or ass from the stall, and having led away, doth water [it]?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and this one, being a daughter of Abraham, whom the Adversary bound, lo, eighteen years, did it not behove to be loosed from this bond on the sabbath-day?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he saying these things, all who were opposed to him were being ashamed, and all the multitude were rejoicing over all the glorious things that are being done by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, `To what is the reign of God like? and to what shall I liken it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like to a grain of mustard, which a man having taken, did cast into his garden, and it increased, and came to a great tree, and the fowls of the heavens did rest in its branches.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again he said, `To what shall I liken the reign of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like leaven, which a woman, having taken, did hide in three measures of meal, till that all was leavened.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was going through cities and villages, teaching, and making progress toward Jerusalem;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a certain one said to him, `Sir, are those saved few?' and he said unto them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Be striving to go in through the straight gate, because many, I say to you, will seek to go in, and shall not be able;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the time the master of the house may have risen up, and may have shut the door, and ye may begin without to stand, and to knock at the door, saying, Lord, lord, open to us, and he answering shall say to you, I have not known you whence ye are,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then ye may begin to say, We did eat before thee, and did drink, and in our broad places thou didst teach;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he shall say, I say to you, I have not known you whence ye are; depart from me, all ye workers of the unrighteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `There shall be there the weeping and the gnashing of the teeth, when ye may see Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, and all the prophets, in the reign of God, and yourselves being cast out without;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they shall come from east and west, and from north and south, and shall recline in the reign of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and lo, there are last who shall be first, and there are first who shall be last.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day there came near certain Pharisees, saying to him, `Go forth, and be going on hence, for Herod doth wish to kill thee;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to them, `Having gone, say to this fox, Lo, I cast forth demons, and perfect cures to-day and to-morrow, and the third [day] I am being perfected;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but it behoveth me to-day, and to-morrow, and the [day] following, to go on, because it is not possible for a prophet to perish out of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Jerusalem, Jerusalem, that is killing the prophets, and stoning those sent unto her, how often did I will to gather together thy children, as a hen her brood under the wings, and ye did not will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Lo, your house is being left to you desolate, and verily I say to you -- ye may not see me, till it may come, when ye may say, Blessed [is] he who is coming in the name of the Lord.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, on his going into the house of a certain one of the chiefs of the Pharisees, on a sabbath, to eat bread, that they were watching him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and lo, there was a certain dropsical man before him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus answering spake to the lawyers and Pharisees, saying, `Is it lawful on the sabbath-day to heal?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were silent, and having taken hold of [him], he healed him, and let [him] go;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and answering them he said, `Of which of you shall an ass or ox fall into a pit, and he will not immediately draw it up on the sabbath-day?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were not able to answer him again unto these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spake a simile unto those called, marking how they were choosing out the first couches, saying unto them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When thou mayest be called by any one to marriage-feasts, thou mayest not recline on the first couch, lest a more honourable than thou may have been called by him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he who did call thee and him having come shall say to thee, Give to this one place, and then thou mayest begin with shame to occupy the last place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `But, when thou mayest be called, having gone on, recline in the last place, that when he who called thee may come, he may say to thee, Friend, come up higher; then thou shalt have glory before those reclining with thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because every one who is exalting himself shall be humbled, and he who is humbling himself shall be exalted.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said also to him who did call him, `When thou mayest make a dinner or a supper, be not calling thy friends, nor thy brethren, nor thy kindred, nor rich neighbours, lest they may also call thee again, and a recompense may come to thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when thou mayest make a feast, be calling poor, maimed, lame, blind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and happy thou shalt be, because they have not to recompense thee, for it shall be recompensed to thee in the rising again of the righteous.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of those reclining with him, having heard these things, said to him, `Happy [is] he who shall eat bread in the reign of God;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to him, `A certain man made a great supper, and called many,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he sent his servant at the hour of the supper to say to those having been called, Be coming, because now are all things ready.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And they began with one consent all to excuse themselves: The first said to him, A field I bought, and I have need to go forth and see it; I beg of thee, have me excused.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And another said, Five yoke of oxen I bought, and I go on to prove them; I beg of thee, have me excused:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and another said, A wife I married, and because of this I am not able to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And that servant having come, told to his lord these things, then the master of the house, having been angry, said to his servant, Go forth quickly to the broad places and lanes of the city, and the poor, and maimed, and lame, and blind, bring in hither.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the servant said, Sir, it hath been done as thou didst command, and still there is room.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the lord said unto the servant, Go forth to the ways and hedges, and constrain to come in, that my house may be filled;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I say to you, that none of those men who have been called shall taste of my supper.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were going on with him great multitudes, and having turned, he said unto them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `If any one doth come unto me, and doth not hate his own father, and mother, and wife, and children, and brothers, and sisters, and yet even his own life, he is not able to be my disciple;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and whoever doth not bear his cross, and come after me, is not able to be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `For who of you, willing to build a tower, doth not first, having sat down, count the expense, whether he have the things for completing?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest that he having laid a foundation, and not being able to finish, all who are beholding may begin to mock him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying -- This man began to build, and was not able to finish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Or what king going on to engage with another king in war, doth not, having sat down, first consult if he be able with ten thousand to meet him who with twenty thousand is coming against him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if not so -- he being yet a long way off -- having sent an embassy, he doth ask the things for peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `So, then, every one of you who doth not take leave of all that he himself hath, is not able to be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The salt [is] good, but if the salt doth become tasteless, with what shall it be seasoned?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: neither for land nor for manure is it fit -- they cast it without. He who is having ears to hear -- let him hear.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the tax-gatherers and the sinners were coming nigh to him, to hear him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Pharisees and the scribes were murmuring, saying -- This one doth receive sinners, and doth eat with them.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spake unto them this simile, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `What man of you having a hundred sheep, and having lost one out of them, doth not leave behind the ninety-nine in the wilderness, and go on after the lost one, till he may find it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having found, he doth lay [it] on his shoulders rejoicing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having come to the house, he doth call together the friends and the neighbours, saying to them, Rejoice with me, because I found my sheep -- the lost one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `I say to you, that so joy shall be in the heaven over one sinner reforming, rather than over ninety-nine righteous men, who have no need of reformation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Or what woman having ten drachms, if she may lose one drachm, doth not light a lamp, and sweep the house, and seek carefully till that she may find?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having found, she doth call together the female friends and the neighbours, saying, Rejoice with me, for I found the drachm that I lost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `So I say to you, joy doth come before the messengers of God over one sinner reforming.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, `A certain man had two sons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the younger of them said to the father, Father, give me the portion of the substance falling to [me], and he divided to them the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And not many days after, having gathered all together, the younger son went abroad to a far country, and there he scattered his substance, living riotously;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he having spent all, there came a mighty famine on that country, and himself began to be in want;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having gone on, he joined himself to one of the citizens of that country, and he sent him to the fields to feed swine,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he was desirous to fill his belly from the husks that the swine were eating, and no one was giving to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And having come to himself, he said, How many hirelings of my father have a superabundance of bread, and I here with hunger am perishing!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having risen, I will go on unto my father, and will say to him, Father, I did sin -- to the heaven, and before thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and no more am I worthy to be called thy son; make me as one of thy hirelings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And having risen, he went unto his own father, and he being yet far distant, his father saw him, and was moved with compassion, and having ran he fell upon his neck and kissed him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the son said to him, Father, I did sin -- to the heaven, and before thee, and no more am I worthy to be called thy son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the father said unto his servants, Bring forth the first robe, and clothe him, and give a ring for his hand, and sandals for the feet;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having brought the fatted calf, kill [it], and having eaten, we may be merry,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because this my son was dead, and did live again, and he was lost, and was found; and they began to be merry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And his elder son was in a field, and as, coming, he drew nigh to the house, he heard music and dancing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having called near one of the young men, he was inquiring what these things might be,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to him -- Thy brother is arrived, and thy father did kill the fatted calf, because in health he did receive him back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he was angry, and would not go in, therefore his father, having come forth, was entreating him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he answering said to the father, Lo, so many years I do serve thee, and never thy command did I transgress, and to me thou didst never give a kid, that with my friends I might make merry;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when thy son -- this one who did devour thy living with harlots -- came, thou didst kill to him the fatted calf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he said to him, Child, thou art always with me, and all my things are thine;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but to be merry, and to be glad, it was needful, because this thy brother was dead, and did live again, he was lost, and was found.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said also unto his disciples, `A certain man was rich, who had a steward, and he was accused to him as scattering his goods;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having called him, he said to him, What [is] this I hear about thee? render the account of thy stewardship, for thou mayest not any longer be steward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the steward said in himself, What shall I do, because my lord doth take away the stewardship from me? to dig I am not able, to beg I am ashamed: --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have known what I shall do, that, when I may be removed from the stewardship, they may receive me to their houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And having called near each one of his lord's debtors, he said to the first, How much dost thou owe to my lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, A hundred baths of oil; and he said to him, Take thy bill, and having sat down write fifty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Afterward to another he said, And thou, how much dost thou owe? and he said, A hundred cors of wheat; and he saith to him, Take thy bill, and write eighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the lord commended the unrighteous steward that he did prudently, because the sons of this age are more prudent than the sons of the light, in respect to their generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I say to you, Make to yourselves friends out of the mammon of unrighteousness, that when ye may fail, they may receive you to the age-during tabernacles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `He who is faithful in the least, [is] also faithful in much; and he who in the least [is] unrighteous, is also unrighteous in much;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if, then, in the unrighteous mammon ye became not faithful -- the true who will entrust to you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if in the other's ye became not faithful -- your own, who shall give to you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `No domestic is able to serve two lords, for either the one he will hate, and the other he will love; or one he will hold to, and of the other he will be heedless; ye are not able to serve God and mammon.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And also the Pharisees, being lovers of money, were hearing all these things, and were deriding him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to them, `Ye are those declaring yourselves righteous before men, but God doth know your hearts; because that which among men is high, [is] abomination before God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the law and the prophets [are] till John; since then the reign of God is proclaimed good news, and every one doth press into it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it is easier to the heaven and the earth to pass away, than of the law one tittle to fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Every one who is sending away his wife, and marrying another, doth commit adultery; and every one who is marrying her sent away from a husband doth commit adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And -- a certain man was rich, and was clothed in purple and fine linen, making merry sumptuously every day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there was a certain poor man, by name Lazarus, who was laid at his porch, full of sores,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and desiring to be filled from the crumbs that are falling from the table of the rich man; yea, also the dogs, coming, were licking his sores.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And it came to pass, that the poor man died, and that he was carried away by the messengers to the bosom of Abraham -- and the rich man also died, and was buried;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in the hades having lifted up his eyes, being in torments, he doth see Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having cried, he said, Father Abraham, deal kindly with me, and send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of his finger in water, and may cool my tongue, because I am distressed in this flame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And Abraham said, Child, remember that thou did receive -- thou -- thy good things in thy life, and Lazarus in like manner the evil things, and now he is comforted, and thou art distressed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and besides all these things, between us and you a great chasm is fixed, so that they who are willing to go over from hence unto you are not able, nor do they from thence to us pass through.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he said, I pray thee, then, father, that thou mayest send him to the house of my father,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I have five brothers, so that he may thoroughly testify to them, that they also may not come to this place of torment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Abraham saith to him, They have Moses and the prophets, let them hear them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, No, father Abraham, but if any one from the dead may go unto them, they will reform.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, If Moses and the prophets they do not hear, neither if one may rise out of the dead will they be persuaded.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto the disciples, `It is impossible for the stumbling blocks not to come, but wo [to him] through whom they come;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it is more profitable to him if a weighty millstone is put round about his neck, and he hath been cast into the sea, than that he may cause one of these little ones to stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Take heed to yourselves, and, if thy brother may sin in regard to thee, rebuke him, and if he may reform, forgive him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if seven times in the day he may sin against thee, and seven times in the day may turn back to thee, saying, I reform; thou shalt forgive him.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the apostles said to the Lord, `Add to us faith;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Lord said, `If ye had faith as a grain of mustard, ye would have said to this sycamine, Be uprooted, and be planted in the sea, and it would have obeyed you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `But, who is he of you -- having a servant ploughing or feeding -- who, to him having come in out of the field, will say, Having come near, recline at meat?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but will not [rather] say to him, Prepare what I may sup, and having girded thyself about, minister to me, till I eat and drink, and after these things thou shalt eat and drink?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hath he favour to that servant because he did the things directed? I think not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `So also ye, when ye may have done all the things directed you, say -- We are unprofitable servants, because that which we owed to do -- we have done.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, in his going on to Jerusalem, that he passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he entering into a certain village, there met him ten leprous men, who stood afar off,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they lifted up the voice, saying, `Jesus, master, deal kindly with us;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having seen [them], he said to them, `Having gone on, shew yourselves to the priests;' and it came to pass, in their going, they were cleansed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one of them having seen that he was healed did turn back, with a loud voice glorifying God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he fell upon [his] face at his feet, giving thanks to him, and he was a Samaritan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answering said, `Were not the ten cleansed, and the nine -- where?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were not found who did turn back to give glory to God, except this alien;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to him, `Having risen, be going on, thy faith hath saved thee.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having been questioned by the Pharisees, when the reign of God doth come, he answered them, and said, `The reign of God doth not come with observation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor shall they say, Lo, here; or lo, there; for lo, the reign of God is within you.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto his disciples, `Days will come, when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and ye shall not behold [it];
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they shall say to you, Lo, here; or lo, there; ye may not go away, nor follow;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for as the lightning that is lightening out of the one [part] under heaven, to the other part under heaven doth shine, so shall be also the Son of Man in his day;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and first it behoveth him to suffer many things, and to be rejected by this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And, as it came to pass in the days of Noah, so shall it be also in the days of the Son of Man;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they were eating, they were drinking, they were marrying, they were given in marriage, till the day that Noah entered into the ark, and the deluge came, and destroyed all;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in like manner also, as it came to pass in the days of Lot; they were eating, they were drinking, they were buying, they were selling, they were planting, they were building;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and on the day Lot went forth from Sodom, He rained fire and brimstone from heaven, and destroyed all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `According to these things it shall be, in the day the Son of Man is revealed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in that day, he who shall be on the house top, and his vessels in the house, let him not come down to take them away; and he in the field, in like manner, let him not turn backward;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: remember the wife of Lot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever may seek to save his life, shall lose it; and whoever may lose it, shall preserve it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `I say to you, In that night, there shall be two men on one couch, the one shall be taken, and the other shall be left;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: two women shall be grinding at the same place together, the one shall be taken, and the other shall be left;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: two men shall be in the field, the one shall be taken, and the other left.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they answering say to him, `Where, sir?' and he said to them, `Where the body [is], there will the eagles be gathered together.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spake also a simile to them, that it behoveth [us] always to pray, and not to faint,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, `A certain judge was in a certain city -- God he is not fearing, and man he is not regarding --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a widow was in that city, and she was coming unto him, saying, Do me justice on my opponent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he would not for a time, but after these things he said in himself, Even if God I do not fear, and man do not regard,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet because this widow doth give me trouble, I will do her justice, lest, perpetually coming, she may plague me.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, `Hear ye what the unrighteous judge saith:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and shall not God execute the justice to His choice ones, who are crying unto Him day and night -- bearing long in regard to them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say to you, that He will execute the justice to them quickly; but the Son of Man having come, shall he find the faith upon the earth?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spake also unto certain who have been trusting in themselves that they were righteous, and have been despising the rest, this simile:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Two men went up to the temple to pray, the one a Pharisee, and the other a tax-gatherer;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Pharisee having stood by himself, thus prayed: God, I thank Thee that I am not as the rest of men, rapacious, unrighteous, adulterers, or even as this tax-gatherer;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I fast twice in the week, I give tithes of all things -- as many as I possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the tax-gatherer, having stood afar off, would not even the eyes lift up to the heaven, but was smiting on his breast, saying, God be propitious to me -- the sinner!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say to you, this one went down declared righteous, to his house, rather than that one: for every one who is exalting himself shall be humbled, and he who is humbling himself shall be exalted.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were bringing near also the babes, that he may touch them, and the disciples having seen did rebuke them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus having called them near, said, `Suffer the little children to come unto me, and forbid them not, for of such is the reign of God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: verily I say to you, Whoever may not receive the reign of God as a little child, may not enter into it.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain ruler questioned him, saying, `Good teacher, what having done -- shall I inherit life age-during?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, `Why me dost thou call good? no one [is] good, except One -- God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the commands thou hast known: Thou mayest not commit adultery, Thou mayest do no murder, Thou mayest not steal, Thou mayest not bear false witness, Honour thy father and thy mother.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, `All these I did keep from my youth;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having heard these things, Jesus said to him, `Yet one thing to thee is lacking; all things -- as many as thou hast -- sell, and distribute to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven, and come, be following me;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he, having heard these things, became very sorrowful, for he was exceeding rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus having seen him become very sorrowful, said, `How hardly shall those having riches enter into the reign of God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for it is easier for a camel through the eye of a needle to enter, than for a rich man into the reign of God to enter.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who heard, said, `And who is able to be saved?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, `The things impossible with men are possible with God.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter said, `Lo, we left all, and did follow thee;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to them, `Verily I say to you, that there is not one who left house, or parents, or brothers, or wife, or children, for the sake of the reign of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who may not receive back manifold more in this time, and in the coming age, life age-during.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having taken the twelve aside, he said unto them, `Lo, we go up to Jerusalem, and all things shall be completed -- that have been written through the prophets -- to the Son of Man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he shall be delivered up to the nations, and shall be mocked, and insulted, and spit upon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having scourged they shall put him to death, and on the third day he shall rise again.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they none of these things understood, and this saying was hid from them, and they were not knowing the things said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, in his coming nigh to Jericho, a certain blind man was sitting beside the way begging,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having heard a multitude going by, he was inquiring what this may be,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they brought him word that Jesus the Nazarene doth pass by,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he cried out, saying, `Jesus, Son of David, deal kindly with me;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and those going before were rebuking him, that he might be silent, but he was much more crying out, `Son of David, deal kindly with me.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus having stood, commanded him to be brought unto him, and he having come nigh, he questioned him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, `What wilt thou I shall do to thee?' and he said, `Sir, that I may receive sight.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, `Receive thy sight; thy faith hath saved thee;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and presently he did receive sight, and was following him, glorifying God; and all the people, having seen, did give praise to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having entered, he was passing through Jericho,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and lo, a man, by name called Zaccheus, and he was a chief tax-gatherer, and he was rich,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he was seeking to see Jesus, who he is, and was not able for the multitude, because in stature he was small,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having run forward before, he went up on a sycamore, that he may see him, because through that [way] he was about to pass by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as Jesus came up to the place, having looked up, he saw him, and said unto him, `Zaccheus, having hastened, come down, for to-day in thy house it behoveth me to remain;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he having hastened did come down, and did receive him rejoicing;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having seen [it], they were all murmuring, saying -- `With a sinful man he went in to lodge!'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zaccheus having stood, said unto the Lord, `Lo, the half of my goods, sir, I give to the poor, and if of any one anything I did take by false accusation, I give back fourfold.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto him -- `To-day salvation did come to this house, inasmuch as he also is a son of Abraham;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the Son of Man came to seek and to save the lost.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they are hearing these things, having added he spake a simile, because of his being nigh to Jerusalem, and of their thinking that the reign of God is about presently to be made manifest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said therefore, `A certain man of birth went on to a far country, to take to himself a kingdom, and to return,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having called ten servants of his own, he gave to them ten pounds, and said unto them, Do business -- till I come;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his citizens were hating him, and did send an embassy after him, saying, We do not wish this one to reign over us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And it came to pass, on his coming back, having taken the kingdom, that he commanded these servants to be called to him, to whom he gave the money, that he might know what any one had done in business.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the first came near, saying, Sir, thy pound did gain ten pounds;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to him, Well done, good servant, because in a very little thou didst become faithful, be having authority over ten cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the second came, saying, Sir, thy pound made five pounds;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said also to this one, And thou, become thou over five cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And another came, saying, Sir, lo, thy pound, that I had lying away in a napkin;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I was afraid of thee, because thou art an austere man; thou takest up what thou didst not lay down, and reapest what thou didst not sow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he saith to him, Out of thy mouth I will judge thee, evil servant: thou knewest that I am an austere man, taking up what I did not lay down, and reaping what I did not sow!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and wherefore didst thou not give my money to the bank, and I, having come, with interest might have received it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And to those standing by he said, Take from him the pound, and give to him having the ten pounds --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (and they said to him, Sir, he hath ten pounds) --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I say to you, that to every one having shall be given, and from him not having, also what he hath shall be taken from him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but those my enemies, who did not wish me to reign over them, bring hither and slay before me.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having said these things, he went on before, going up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, as he came nigh to Bethphage and Bethany, unto the mount called of the Olives, he sent two of his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having said, Go away to the village over-against, in which, entering into, ye shall find a colt bound, on which no one of men did ever sit, having loosed it, bring [it];
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if any one doth question you, Wherefore do ye loose [it]? thus ye shall say to him -- The Lord hath need of it.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those sent, having gone away, found according as he said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and while they are loosing the colt, its owners said unto them, `Why loose ye the colt?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they said, `The Lord hath need of it;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they brought it unto Jesus, and having cast their garments upon the colt, they did set Jesus upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he is going, they were spreading their garments in the way,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and as he is coming nigh now, at the descent of the mount of the Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began rejoicing to praise God with a great voice for all the mighty works they had seen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, `blessed [is] he who is coming, a king in the name of the Lord; peace in heaven, and glory in the highest.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And certain of the Pharisees from the multitude said unto him, `Teacher, rebuke thy disciples;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he answering said to them, `I say to you, that, if these shall be silent, the stones will cry out!'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he came nigh, having seen the city, he wept over it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying -- `If thou didst know, even thou, at least in this thy day, the things for thy peace; but now they were hid from thine eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Because days shall come upon thee, and thine enemies shall cast around thee a rampart, and compass thee round, and press thee on every side,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and lay thee low, and thy children within thee, and they shall not leave in thee a stone upon a stone, because thou didst not know the time of thy inspection.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having entered into the temple, he began to cast forth those selling in it, and those buying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying to them, `It hath been written, My house is a house of prayer -- but ye made it a den of robbers.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was teaching daily in the temple, but the chief priests and the scribes were seeking to destroy him -- also the chiefs of the people --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were not finding what they shall do, for all the people were hanging on him, hearing him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, on one of those days, as he is teaching the people in the temple, and proclaiming good news, the chief priests and the scribes, with the elders, came upon [him],
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and spake unto him, saying, `Tell us by what authority thou dost these things? or who is he that gave to thee this authority?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answering said unto them, `I will question you -- I also -- one thing, and tell me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the baptism of John, from heaven was it, or from men?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they reasoned with themselves, saying -- `If we may say, From heaven, he will say, Wherefore, then, did ye not believe him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if we may say, From men, all the people will stone us, for they are having been persuaded John to be a prophet.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they answered, that they knew not whence [it was],
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus said to them, `Neither do I say to you by what authority I do these things.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he began to speak unto the people this simile: `A certain man planted a vineyard, and gave it out to husbandmen, and went abroad for a long time,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and at the season he sent unto the husbandmen a servant, that from the fruit of the vineyard they may give to him, but the husbandmen having beat him, did send [him] away empty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he added to send another servant, and they that one also having beaten and dishonoured, did send away empty;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he added to send a third, and this one also, having wounded, they did cast out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the owner of the vineyard said, What shall I do? I will send my son -- the beloved, perhaps having seen this one, they will do reverence;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having seen him, the husbandmen reasoned among themselves, saying, This is the heir; come, we may kill him, that the inheritance may become ours;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having cast him outside of the vineyard, they killed [him]; what, then, shall the owner of the vineyard do to them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will come, and destroy these husbandmen, and will give the vineyard to others.' And having heard, they said, `Let it not be!'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he, having looked upon them, said, `What, then, is this that hath been written: A stone that the builders rejected -- this became head of a corner?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: every one who hath fallen on that stone shall be broken, and on whom it may fall, it will crush him to pieces.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chief priests and the scribes sought to lay hands on him in that hour, and they feared the people, for they knew that against them he spake this simile.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, having watched [him], they sent forth liers in wait, feigning themselves to be righteous, that they might take hold of his word, to deliver him up to the rule and to the authority of the governor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they questioned him, saying, `Teacher, we have known that thou dost say and teach rightly, and dost not accept a person, but in truth the way of God dost teach;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it lawful to us to give tribute to Caesar or not?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he, having perceived their craftiness, said unto them, `Why me do ye tempt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: shew me a denary; of whom hath it an image and superscription?' and they answering said, `Of Caesar:'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to them, `Give back, therefore, the things of Caesar to Caesar, and the things of God to God;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were not able to take hold on his saying before the people, and having wondered at his answer, they were silent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And certain of the Sadducees, who are denying that there is a rising again, having come near, questioned him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, `Teacher, Moses wrote to us, If any one's brother may die, having a wife, and he may die childless -- that his brother may take the wife, and may raise up seed to his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `There were, then, seven brothers, and the first having taken a wife, died childless,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the second took the wife, and he died childless,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the third took her, and in like manner also the seven -- they left not children, and they died;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and last of all died also the woman:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the rising again, then, of which of them doth she become wife? -- for the seven had her as wife.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answering said to them, `The sons of this age do marry and are given in marriage,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but those accounted worthy to obtain that age, and the rising again that is out of the dead, neither marry, nor are they given in marriage;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for neither are they able to die any more -- for they are like messengers -- and they are sons of God, being sons of the rising again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And that the dead are raised, even Moses shewed at the Bush, since he doth call the Lord, the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He is not a God of dead men, but of living, for all live to Him.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And certain of the scribes answering said, `Teacher, thou didst say well;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and no more durst they question him anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, `How do they say the Christ to be son of David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and David himself saith in the Book of Psalms, The Lord said to my lord, Sit thou on my right hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: till I shall make thine enemies thy footstool;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David, then, doth call him lord, and how is he his son?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, all the people hearing, he said to his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Take heed of the scribes, who are wishing to walk in long robes, and are loving salutations in the markets, and first seats in the synagogues, and first couches in the suppers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who devour the houses of the widows, and for a pretence make long prayers, these shall receive more abundant judgment.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having looked up, he saw those who did cast their gifts to the treasury -- rich men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he saw also a certain poor widow casting there two mites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, `Truly I say to you, that this poor widow did cast in more than all;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for all these out of their superabundance did cast into the gifts to God, but this one out of her want, all the living that she had, did cast in.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And certain saying about the temple, that with goodly stones and devoted things it hath been adorned, he said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `These things that ye behold -- days will come, in which there shall not be left a stone upon a stone, that shall not be thrown down.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they questioned him, saying, `Teacher, when, then, shall these things be? and what [is] the sign when these things may be about to happen?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, `See -- ye may not be led astray, for many shall come in my name, saying -- I am [he], and the time hath come nigh; go not on then after them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when ye may hear of wars and uprisings, be not terrified, for it behoveth these things to happen first, but the end [is] not immediately.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said he to them, `Nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: great shakings also in every place, and famines, and pestilences, there shall be; fearful things also, and great signs from heaven there shall be;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and before all these, they shall lay on you their hands, and persecute, delivering up to synagogues and prisons, being brought before kings and governors for my name's sake;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it shall become to you for a testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Settle, then, to your hearts, not to meditate beforehand to reply,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I will give to you a mouth and wisdom that all your opposers shall not be able to refute or resist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And ye shall be delivered up also by parents, and brothers, and kindred, and friends, and they shall put of you to death;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye shall be hated by all because of my name --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a hair out of your head shall not perish;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in your patience possess ye your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when ye may see Jerusalem surrounded by encampments, then know that come nigh did her desolation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then those in Judea, let them flee to the mountains; and those in her midst, let them depart out; and those in the countries, let them not come in to her;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because these are days of vengeance, to fulfil all things that have been written.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And wo to those with child, and to those giving suck, in those days; for there shall be great distress on the land, and wrath on this people;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they shall fall by the mouth of the sword, and shall be led captive to all the nations, and Jerusalem shall be trodden down by nations, till the times of nations be fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And there shall be signs in sun, and moon, and stars, and on the land [is] distress of nations with perplexity, sea and billow roaring;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: men fainting at heart from fear, and expectation of the things coming on the world, for the powers of the heavens shall be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And then they shall see the Son of Man, coming in a cloud, with power and much glory;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and these things beginning to happen bend yourselves back, and lift up your heads, because your redemption doth draw nigh.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spake a simile to them: `See the fig-tree, and all the trees,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when they may now cast forth, having seen, of yourselves ye know that now is the summer nigh;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so also ye, when ye may see these things happening, ye know that near is the reign of God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: verily I say to you -- This generation may not pass away till all may have come to pass;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the heaven and the earth shall pass away, but my words may not pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And take heed to yourselves, lest your hearts may be weighed down with surfeiting, and drunkenness, and anxieties of life, and suddenly that day may come on you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for as a snare it shall come on all those dwelling on the face of all the land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: watch ye, then, in every season, praying that ye may be accounted worthy to escape all these things that are about to come to pass, and to stand before the Son of Man.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was during the days in the temple teaching, and during the nights, going forth, he was lodging at the mount called of Olives;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the people were coming early unto him in the temple to hear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the feast of the unleavened food was coming nigh, that is called Passover,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the chief priests and the scribes were seeking how they may take him up, for they were afraid of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Adversary entered into Judas, who is surnamed Iscariot, being of the number of the twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he, having gone away, spake with the chief priests and the magistrates, how he might deliver him up to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they rejoiced, and covenanted to give him money,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he agreed, and was seeking a favourable season to deliver him up to them without tumult.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the day of the unleavened food came, in which it was behoving the passover to be sacrificed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he sent Peter and John, saying, `Having gone on, prepare to us the passover, that we may eat;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they said to him, `Where wilt thou that we might prepare?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, `Lo, in your entering into the city, there shall meet you a man, bearing a pitcher of water, follow him to the house where he doth go in,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye shall say to the master of the house, The Teacher saith to thee, Where is the guest-chamber where the passover with my disciples I may eat?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he shall show you a large upper room furnished, there make ready;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they, having gone away, found as he hath said to them, and they made ready the passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the hour come, he reclined (at meat), and the twelve apostles with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said unto them, `With desire I did desire to eat this passover with you before my suffering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I say to you, that no more may I eat of it till it may be fulfilled in the reign of God.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having taken a cup, having given thanks, he said, `Take this and divide to yourselves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I say to you that I may not drink of the produce of the vine till the reign of God may come.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having taken bread, having given thanks, he brake and gave to them, saying, `This is my body, that for you is being given, this do ye -- to remembrance of me.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In like manner, also, the cup after the supping, saying, `This cup [is] the new covenant in my blood, that for you is being poured forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `But, lo, the hand of him delivering me up [is] with me on the table,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and indeed the Son of Man doth go according to what hath been determined; but wo to that man through whom he is being delivered up.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they began to reason among themselves, who then of them it may be, who is about to do this thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there happened also a strife among them -- who of them is accounted to be greater.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, `The kings of the nations do exercise lordship over them, and those exercising authority upon them are called benefactors;
verses.speaker: Narrator
