verses.text: but ye [are] not so, but he who is greater among you -- let him be as the younger; and he who is leading, as he who is ministering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for who is greater? he who is reclining (at meat), or he who is ministering? is it not he who is reclining (at meat)? and I -- I am in your midst as he who is ministering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And ye -- ye are those who have remained with me in my temptations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I appoint to you, as my Father did appoint to me, a kingdom,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that ye may eat and may drink at my table, in my kingdom, and may sit on thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, `Simon, Simon, lo, the Adversary did ask you for himself to sift as the wheat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I besought for thee, that thy faith may not fail; and thou, when thou didst turn, strengthen thy brethren.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, `Sir, with thee I am ready both to prison and to death to go;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, `I say to thee, Peter, a cock shall not crow to-day, before thrice thou mayest disown knowing me.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, `When I sent you without bag, and scrip, and sandals, did ye lack anything?' and they said, `Nothing.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said he to them, `But, now, he who is having a bag, let him take [it] up, and in like manner also a scrip; and he who is not having, let him sell his garment, and buy a sword,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I say to you, that yet this that hath been written it behoveth to be fulfilled in me: And with lawless ones he was reckoned, for also the things concerning me have an end.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, `Sir, lo, here [are] two swords;' and he said to them, `It is sufficient.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having gone forth, he went on, according to custom, to the mount of the Olives, and his disciples also followed him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having come to the place, he said to them, `Pray ye not to enter into temptation.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was withdrawn from them, as it were a stone's cast, and having fallen on the knees he was praying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, `Father, if Thou be counselling to make this cup pass from me --; but, not my will, but Thine be done.' --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there appeared to him a messenger from heaven strengthening him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having been in agony, he was more earnestly praying, and his sweat became, as it were, great drops of blood falling upon the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having risen up from the prayer, having come unto the disciples, he found them sleeping from the sorrow,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to them, `Why do ye sleep? having risen, pray that ye may not enter into temptation.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while he is speaking, lo, a multitude, and he who is called Judas, one of the twelve, was coming before them, and he came nigh to Jesus to kiss him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus said to him, `Judas, with a kiss the Son of Man dost thou deliver up?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those about him, having seen what was about to be, said to him, `Sir, shall we smite with a sword?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain one of them smote the servant of the chief priest, and took off his right ear,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus answering said, `Suffer ye thus far,' and having touched his ear, he healed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to those having come upon him -- chief priests, and magistrates of the temple, and elders -- `As upon a robber have ye come forth, with swords and sticks?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while daily I was with you in the temple, ye did stretch forth no hands against me; but this is your hour and the power of the darkness.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having taken him, they led and brought him to the house of the chief priest. And Peter was following afar off,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they having kindled a fire in the midst of the court, and having sat down together, Peter was sitting in the midst of them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a certain maid having seen him sitting at the light, and having earnestly looked at him, she said, `And this one was with him!'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he disowned him, saying, `Woman, I have not known him.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after a little, another having seen him, said, `And thou art of them!' and Peter said, `Man, I am not.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one hour, as it were, having intervened, a certain other was confidently affirming, saying, `Of a truth this one also was with him, for he is also a Galilean;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Peter said, `Man, I have not known what thou sayest;' and presently, while he is speaking, a cock crew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord having turned did look on Peter, and Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how he said to him -- `Before a cock shall crow, thou mayest disown me thrice;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Peter having gone without, wept bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men who were holding Jesus were mocking him, beating [him];
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having blindfolded him, they were striking him on the face, and were questioning him, saying, `Prophesy who he is who smote thee?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and many other things, speaking evilly, they spake in regard to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it became day there was gathered together the eldership of the people, chief priests also, and scribes, and they led him up to their own sanhedrim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, `If thou be the Christ, tell us.' And he said to them, `If I may tell you, ye will not believe;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if I also question [you], ye will not answer me or send me away;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: henceforth, there shall be the Son of Man sitting on the right hand of the power of God.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they all said, `Thou, then, art the Son of God?' and he said unto them, `Ye say [it], because I am;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they said, `What need yet have we of testimony? for we ourselves did hear [it] from his mouth.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having risen, the whole multitude of them did lead him to Pilate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and began to accuse him, saying, `This one we found perverting the nation, and forbidding to give tribute to Caesar, saying himself to be Christ a king.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pilate questioned him, saying, `Thou art the king of the Jews?' and he answering him, said, `Thou dost say [it].'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pilate said unto the chief priests, and the multitude, `I find no fault in this man;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were the more urgent, saying -- `He doth stir up the people, teaching throughout the whole of Judea -- having begun from Galilee -- unto this place.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pilate having heard of Galilee, questioned if the man is a Galilean,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having known that he is from the jurisdiction of Herod, he sent him back unto Herod, he being also in Jerusalem in those days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Herod having seen Jesus did rejoice exceedingly, for he was wishing for a long [time] to see him, because of hearing many things about him, and he was hoping some sign to see done by him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and was questioning him in many words, and he answered him nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chief priests and the scribes stood vehemently accusing him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Herod with his soldiers having set him at nought, and having mocked, having put around him gorgeous apparel, did send him back to Pilate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and both Pilate and Herod became friends on that day with one another, for they were before at enmity between themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pilate having called together the chief priests, and the rulers, and the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: said unto them, `Ye brought to me this man as perverting the people, and lo, I before you having examined, found in this man no fault in those things ye bring forward against him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: no, nor yet Herod, for I sent you back unto him, and lo, nothing worthy of death is having been done by him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having chastised, therefore, I will release him,'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for it was necessary for him to release to them one at every feast,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they cried out -- the whole multitude -- saying, `Away with this one, and release to us Barabbas,'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who had been, because of a certain sedition made in the city, and murder, cast into prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate again then -- wishing to release Jesus -- called to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they were calling out, saying, `Crucify, crucify him.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he a third time said unto them, `Why, what evil did he? no cause of death did I find in him; having chastised him, then, I will release [him].'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were pressing with loud voices asking him to be crucified, and their voices, and those of the chief priests, were prevailing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Pilate gave judgment for their request being done,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he released him who because of sedition and murder hath been cast into the prison, whom they were asking, and Jesus he gave up to their will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they led him away, having taken hold on Simon, a certain Cyrenian, coming from the field, they put on him the cross, to bear [it] behind Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was following him a great multitude of the people, and of women, who also were beating themselves and lamenting him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus having turned unto them, said, `Daughters of Jerusalem, weep not for me, but for yourselves weep ye, and for your children;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for, lo, days do come, in which they shall say, Happy the barren, and wombs that did not bare, and paps that did not give suck;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then they shall begin to say to the mountains, Fall on us, and to the hills, Cover us; --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for, if in the green tree they do these things -- in the dry what may happen?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were also others -- two evil-doers -- with him, to be put to death;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when they came to the place that is called Skull, there they crucified him and the evil-doers, one on the right hand and one on the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said, `Father, forgive them, for they have not known what they do;' and parting his garments they cast a lot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people were standing, looking on, and the rulers also were sneering with them, saying, `Others he saved, let him save himself, if this be the Christ, the choice one of God.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And mocking him also were the soldiers, coming near and offering vinegar to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, `If thou be the king of the Jews, save thyself.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was also a superscription written over him, in letters of Greek, and Roman, and Hebrew, `This is the King of the Jews.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of the evil-doers who were hanged, was speaking evil of him, saying, `If thou be the Christ, save thyself and us.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the other answering, was rebuking him, saying, `Dost thou not even fear God, that thou art in the same judgment?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and we indeed righteously, for things worthy of what we did we receive back, but this one did nothing out of place;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to Jesus, `Remember me, lord, when thou mayest come in thy reign;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus said to him, `Verily I say to thee, To-day with me thou shalt be in the paradise.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was, as it were, the sixth hour, and darkness came over all the land till the ninth hour,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sun was darkened, and the vail of the sanctuary was rent in the midst,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having cried with a loud voice, Jesus said, `Father, to Thy hands I commit my spirit;' and these things having said, he breathed forth the spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the centurion having seen what was done, did glorify God, saying, `Really this man was righteous;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the multitudes who were come together to this sight, beholding the things that came to pass, smiting their breasts did turn back;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all his acquaintances stood afar off, and women who did follow him from Galilee, beholding these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And lo, a man, by name Joseph, being a counsellor, a man good and righteous,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: -- he was not consenting to their counsel and deed -- from Arimathea, a city of the Jews, who also himself was expecting the reign of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he, having gone near to Pilate, asked the body of Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having taken it down, he wrapped it in fine linen, and placed it in a tomb hewn out, where no one was yet laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the day was a preparation, and sabbath was approaching,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the women also who have come with him out of Galilee having followed after, beheld the tomb, and how his body was placed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having turned back, they made ready spices and ointments, and on the sabbath, indeed, they rested, according to the command.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the first of the sabbaths, at early dawn, they came to the tomb, bearing the spices they made ready, and certain [others] with them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they found the stone having been rolled away from the tomb,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having gone in, they found not the body of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, while they are perplexed about this, that lo, two men stood by them in glittering apparel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and on their having become afraid, and having inclined the face to the earth, they said to them, `Why do ye seek the living with the dead?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he is not here, but was raised; remember how he spake to you, being yet in Galilee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying -- It behoveth the Son of Man to be delivered up to the hands of sinful men, and to be crucified, and the third day to rise again.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they remembered his sayings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having turned back from the tomb told all these things to the eleven, and to all the rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was the Magdalene Mary, and Joanna, and Mary of James, and the other women with them, who told unto the apostles these things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their sayings appeared before them as idle talk, and they were not believing them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter having risen, did run to the tomb, and having stooped down he seeth the linen clothes lying alone, and he went away to his own home, wondering at that which was come to pass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, lo, two of them were going on during that day to a village, distant sixty furlongs from Jerusalem, the name of which [is] Emmaus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were conversing with one another about all these things that have happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass in their conversing and reasoning together, that Jesus himself, having come nigh, was going on with them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their eyes were holden so as not to know him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said unto them, `What [are] these words that ye exchange with one another, walking, and ye are sad?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the one, whose name was Cleopas, answering, said unto him, `Art thou alone such a stranger in Jerusalem, that thou hast not known the things that came to pass in it in these days?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, `What things?' And they said to him, `The things about Jesus of Nazareth, who became a man -- a prophet -- powerful in deed and word, before God and all the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how also the chief priests and our rulers did deliver him up to a judgment of death, and crucified him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and we were hoping that he it is who is about to redeem Israel, and also with all these things, this third day is passing to-day, since these things happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And certain women of ours also astonished us, coming early to the tomb,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not having found his body, they came, saying also to have seen an apparition of messengers, who say he is alive,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and certain of those with us went away unto the tomb, and found as even the women said, and him they saw not.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, `O inconsiderate and slow in heart, to believe on all that the prophets spake!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Was it not behoving the Christ these things to suffer, and to enter into his glory?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having begun from Moses, and from all the prophets, he was expounding to them in all the Writings the things about himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came nigh to the village whither they were going, and he made an appearance of going on further,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they constrained him, saying, `Remain with us, for it is toward evening,' and the day did decline, and he went in to remain with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, in his reclining (at meat) with them, having taken the bread, he blessed, and having broken, he was giving to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their eyes were opened, and they recognized him, and he became unseen by them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said one to another, `Was not our heart burning within us, as he was speaking to us in the way, and as he was opening up to us the Writings?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they, having risen up the same hour, turned back to Jerusalem, and found gathered together the eleven, and those with them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying -- `The Lord was raised indeed, and was seen by Simon;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were telling the things in the way, and how he was made known to them in the breaking of the bread,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and as they are speaking these things, Jesus himself stood in the midst of them, and saith to them, `Peace -- to you;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and being amazed, and becoming affrighted, they were thinking themselves to see a spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, `Why are ye troubled? and wherefore do reasonings come up in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: see my hands and my feet, that I am he; handle me and see, because a spirit hath not flesh and bones, as ye see me having.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having said this, he shewed to them the hands and the feet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and while they are not believing from the joy, and wondering, he said to them, `Have ye anything here to eat?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they gave to him part of a broiled fish, and of an honeycomb,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having taken, he did eat before them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to them, `These [are] the words that I spake unto you, being yet with you, that it behoveth to be fulfilled all the things that are written in the Law of Moses, and the Prophets, and the Psalms, about me.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then opened he up their understanding to understand the Writings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to them -- `Thus it hath been written, and thus it was behoving the Christ to suffer, and to rise out of the dead the third day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and reformation and remission of sins to be proclaimed in his name to all the nations, beginning from Jerusalem:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye -- ye are witnesses of these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And, lo, I do send the promise of my Father upon you, but ye -- abide ye in the city of Jerusalem till ye be clothed with power from on high.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he led them forth without -- unto Bethany, and having lifted up his hands he did bless them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it came to pass, in his blessing them, he was parted from them, and was borne up to the heaven;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they, having bowed before him, did turn back to Jerusalem with great joy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and were continually in the temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
